municipal code of oconomowoc wisconsin ____________ original 1978 by order of the common council supplement service commencing in 1993 by municode republished in 2003 ____________ ordinance no 17o910 an ordinance to amend the general ordinances of the city of oconomowoc whereas it is deemed expedient and necessary that the municipal the city of oconomowoc be brought up to date  and whereas ordinances adopted #16o895 dated  and changes necessitated by changes in state law have now been incorporated into the municipal   and whereas a copy of such amended code has been on file and open for public inspection in the office of the city clerk for not less than 2 weeks as required by  wis stats and notice thereof was given by publication on  in the oconomowoc focus this being supplement #24 to our republished therefore the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows the ordinances in book form entitled municipal the city of oconomowoc wisconsin as amended shall be and hereby is adopted as the general ordinances in and for the city of oconomowoc wisconsin this take effect after passage and publication as provided by law dated  city of oconomowoc s david nold mayor attest s diane coenen clerk date adopted  date published  effective date  ordinance no 16o894 an ordinance to amend the general ordinances of the city of oconomowoc whereas it is deemed expedient and necessary that the municipal the city of oconomowoc be brought up to date  and whereas ordinances adopted #150886 dated  and changes necessitated by changes in state law have now been incorporated into the municipal   and whereas a copy of such amended code has been on file and open for public inspection in the office of the city clerk for not less than 2 weeks as required by  wis stats and notice thereof was given by publication on  in the oconomowoc focus this being supplement #23 to our republished therefore the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows the ordinances in book form entitled municipal the city of oconomowoc wisconsin as amended shall be and hereby is adopted as the general ordinances in and for the city of oconomowoc wisconsin this take effect after passage and publication as provided by law dated  city of oconomowoc s david nold mayor attest s diane coenen clerk date adopted  date published  effective date  ordinance no 15o878 an common council on  mayor gary kohlenberg became mayor of the city on  and should approve this legislation pursuant to 62098c wis stats mayor kohlenberg has had the opportunity to approve or disapprove as clerk of the city of oconomowoc i certify that the mayor has not approved or disapproved within five days or later and accordingly this action by the common council and this legislation is in force into the municipal   and whereas a copy of such amended code has been on file and open for public inspection in the office of the city clerk for not less than 2 weeks as required by  wis stats and 83079 ordinance no ____________ an ordinance to codify the general ordinance of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin whereas it is deemed expedient and necessary that the general ordinance of the city of oconomowoc be revised codified and arranged in appropriate chapters sections and subsections  that omissions be supplied defects be amended and new ordinances be enacted  and that the same be published in book form to make the whole thereof plain concise intelligible and convenient  and whereas on  the city council authorized the preparation of a code of general ordinances for the city  and whereas a copy of such code has been on file and open for public inspection in the office of the city clerk for not less than two weeks as required by  wis stats and notice thereof was given by publication february 16 and 23 197 in oconomowoc enterprise  now therefore the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows that the code of ordinances in book form entitled municipal the city of oconomowoc wisconsin a copy of which is on file in the office of the city clerk for public inspection shall be and is hereby adopted as the general ordinances in and for the city of oconomowoc wisconsin of the municipal code of the city of oconomowoc does not apply to any ordinance duly passed and adopted since  this ordinance shall take effect the day after passage and publication as provided by law s florence whalen mayor adopted 32178 approved 32178 published 33078 attest s alice l bergman city clerk supplement history table the table below allows users of this quickly and accurately determine what ordinances have been considered for codification in each supplement ordinances that are of a general and permanent nature are codified in the are considered included ordinances that are not of a general and permanent nature are not codified in the are considered omitted in addition by adding to this table with each supplement users of this municipal be able to gain a more complete picture of the s historical evolution date adopted included omitted supplement number 10o778 72010 included 14 10o779 72010 included 14 10o780 9 710 included 14 10o781 public works 122 rep #850154 123 director of parks and recreation 124 superintendent of utilities 125 municipal court and municipal judge boards and commissions 130 architectural commission 131 rep #020533 132 capital improvements commission 133 electrical commission 134 emergency government commission 135 library board 136 plan commission 137 police and fire commission 138 board of public works 139 parks and recreation board 140 board of review 141 rep #880198 142 board of zoning appeals 143 rep #900245 144 bureau of economic development and tourism commission 145 community development authority political boundaries 150 aldermanic districts elections 160 poll hours 161 spring primary form of government 101  mayorcouncil plan the city of oconomowoc shall be organized and governed under the provisions of ch 62 wis stats known as mayorcouncil plan general provisions as to officials 102  elected officials am #890230 1 enumerated the elected officials of the city shall be a mayor 2 aldermen from each aldermanic district and a municipal judge 2 terms a mayor  the mayor shall be elected in the spring election of each even numbered year for a term of 2 years b aldermen  one alderman shall be elected from each aldermanic district each spring for a term of 2 years c municipal judge  see 125 of this chapter 3 time of taking office the regular terms of the mayor and aldermen shall commence on the third tuesday in april succeeding their election the regular terms of all other officials shall commence on may 1 following their election or appointment unless otherwise provided 103  appointed officials 1 tenured officials the following officials shall be appointed by the mayor in writing subject to confirmation by the council and after a one year probationary period shall become tenured officials of the city pursuant to the charter ordinance dated  and may only be removed for cause as provided in 1052 administratortreasurer assessor clerk engineer public works director of director of parks and recreation am #850154 2 nontenured officials am #920289  #960366  #17o912 the following officials shall be appointed in the manner and for the term indicated official how appointed term attorney mayor subject to conf by the council 1 year assistant city attorney mayor subject to conf by the common council 1 year comptroller mayor subject to conf by the council 1 year director of public safety police and fire commission indefinite emergency government director mayor subject to conf by the council 1 year fire chief police and fire commission director of public safety may hold this position indefinite parks and recreation supervisor of dir of parks recreation and subject to conf by the council indefinite plumbing supervisor see 14221a common council 4 years subject to the provisions of 14221a police chief police and fire commission director of public safety may hold this position indefinite public works supervisor of dir of public works subject to conf by the council indefinite utilities director of mayor subject to conf by the council indefinite 104  oaths and bonds elected and appointed officials shall take and file the official oath within 10 days after notice of their election or appointment as provided in 62094a wis stats and shall execute and file the official bond as required by state statutes and this municipal 1 bond of treasurer rep & recr #17o927 a duplicate tax bond eliminated the city elects not to give the bond on the treasurer provided for by 70671 wis stats b city liable for default pursuant to 70672 wis stats the city shall pay if the treasurer fails to do so all state and county taxes required by law to be paid to the county treasurer 105  removals 1 elected officials elected officials may be removed by the city council as provided in 17121a or as provided by 1716 wis stats 2 appointed officials appointed officials may be removed as provided in 17121c and 1716 wis stats 106  vacancies 1 how occurring vacancies in elective and appointive positions are caused as provided in 1703 and  wis stats 2 how filled vacancies in elective and appointive offices shall be filled as provided in 1723 wis stats 107  salaries the salaries of all elected and appointed officials including members of boards and commissions shall be as determined by the city council from time to time provided the salary of the mayor and members of the council shall not be increased during their terms of office see  wis stats 108  receipt of gifts and gratuities 1 restricted no city employee or official shall receive or offer to receive either directly or indirectly any gift gratuity or other thing of value which heshe is not authorized to receive from any person who a has or is seeking to obtain contractual or other business or financial relationships with the city or city council  or b conducts operations or activities which are regulated by the city or city council  or c has interests which may be substantially affected by the city or city council 2 penalty the receipt of any gift gratuity or other thing of value as denoted above is contrary to the public policy of the city and is punishable as provided in 94612 wis stats such conduct shall also be punishable under 2504 of this municipal standard of conduct cr #820102 the purpose of this section is to enable public officials and employees to conduct themselves in a manner that will tend to preserve public confidence in and respect for the government of the city 1 definitions am #860168 the terms used in this section are defined as follows financial interest any interest which shall yield directly or indirectly a monetary or other material benefit to the officer or employee or to any person employing or retaining the services of the officer or employee personal interest any interest arising from blood or marriage relationships or from close business or political associations whether or not any financial interest is involved public employee any person excluded from the definition of a public officer who is employed by the city or by the city water and electric utility public official all of those persons defined in 6209 wis stats and all members of boards commissions and agencies established or appointed by the mayor or city council whether paid or unpaid 2 conflict of interest a financial or personal interest no official or employee either on hisher own behalf or on behalf of any other person shall have any financial or personal interest in any business or transaction with any public body in the city unless heshe shall first make full public disclosure of the nature and extent of such interest b disclosure and disqualification whenever the performance of hisher official duties requires any official or employee to deliberate and vote on any matter involving or appearing to involve hisher financial or personal interest heshe shall publicly disclose the nature and extent of such interest and disqualify himselfherself from voting c incompatible employment 1 no official or employee shall engage in private employment with or render service for any private person who has business transactions with any public body of the city unless heshe shall first make full public disclosure of the nature and extent of such employment or services 2 no person may simultaneously hold a public office and be a public employee any officeremployee holding both an office and employment position in violation of this subsection on the effective date of  may complete hisher current term of office without being required to resign from either the incompatible office or employment position cr #860168 d representation of private persons no official or employee shall use or attempt to use hisher official position to secure special privileges or exemptions for himselfherself or others except as may be otherwise provided by law e gifting no official or employee or immediate member of such persons family shall accept from anyone any gift whether in the form of money thing favor loan or promise hospitality or entertainment that would not be offered or given to himher if heshe were not an official or employee f privileged information no official or employee shall use or permit the use of any privileged or nonpublic information obtained in the course of hisher official duties to advance the financial or personal interest of himselfherself or any other person officials 110  mayor and aldermen 1 election and term see 102 2 duties and powers a mayor see 62098 wis stats b city council the aldermen shall constitute the city council and shall have such duties and powers as are enumerated in ch 62 wis stats and elsewhere in the statutes c police powers see 620914 wis stats 3 authority the city council shall have all powers of the city not specifically given to some other body or officer except as otherwise provided by law the city council shall have the management and control of the city property finances highways streets utilities and the public service and may act for the government and good order of the city for its commercial benefit and for the health safety welfare and convenience of the public and may carry its powers into effect by license regulation suppression borrowing taxation special assessment appropriation imposition of forfeiture and other necessary or convenient means the city council may appoint such officers from time to time as may be deemed necessary for the benefit of the community the powers hereby conferred shall be in addition to all other grants and shall be limited only by express language 4 other provisions see also of this municipal administratortreasurer 1 appointment see 1031 of this chapter 2 duties as treasurer the treasurer shall perform those duties prescribed in 62099 wis stats and such other duties as the council may prescribe the treasurer shall be the investment officer for the city 3 deputy the treasurer may in writing filed with the mayor and in the office of the city clerk appoint a deputy treasurer who shall act under hisher direction and in hisher absence or disability and who shall in case of a vacancy perform hisher duties the deputy shall receive such compensation as the council determines 4 duties as administrator the administrative duties and responsibilities of the city administrator shall be prescribed from time to time by the mayor and the council provided these duties do not usurp the duties or functions that are required by state law to be performed by the city boards commissions and other city officers or department officials the administrator shall have the following specific duties and responsibilities a heshe shall be responsible for effectuating all actions of the council which require administrative implementation or where the mayor or the council have directed himher to act b heshe shall be responsible for directing coordinating and expediting the activities of all city departments except where such authority is vested by state law in officers boards and commissions such responsibilities shall include making or directing such studies as are necessary to determine or bring about the most economical and efficient operation of such departments and their programs as deemed necessary  however the administrator shall not control the activities within the various departments such functional departmental activites to remain under the direct control of the department heads c heshe shall direct and control organizational channels the efficient performance of all city employees duties after the appropriate screening and selection process has been followed the administrator shall submit recommendations to the mayor and the council for appointees to vacancies in any city positions or offices of the city not required by law or ordinance to be otherwise selected d heshe shall be responsible for developing budgeting procedures and preparing or supervising the preparation of the annual operating budget the administrator shall also be responsible for coordinating financial and economic data for the citys longrange financial plan in addition the administrator shall make such reports as the mayor and the council may require as to the current status of budgeted items and shall review and report to the mayor and the council any variations in the operation of the city budget e heshe shall serve as personnel officer for the city and shall be responsible for the development and administration of standardized personnel policies and procedures subject to council approval and in accordance with all prior ordinances relating to tenure of certain city positions f heshe shall be responsible for developing and implementing a standardized purchasing policy and procedure for the city and shall be responsible for supervising the purchasing of all supplies materials and equipment g heshe shall review proposed and pending county state and federal legislation and shall report to the mayor and the council on its effect upon the city in addition the administrator shall appear on the citys behalf at all legislative and administrative hearings as directed by the mayor or the council h heshe shall submit when necessary recommendations and suggestions for improving the health safety or welfare of the residents of the city and shall coordinate a system of communications among and with the mayor and the council as well as with the general public this shall include the establishment of procedures for the facilitation of communications between citizens and the city to assure that complaints grievances recommendations and other matters receive the prompt attention of a responsible official and are expeditiously resolved i heshe shall keep informed concerning current developments in the field of municipal administration and the availability of state and federal funds for local purposes j heshe shall work closely with all department heads to assure that they and other city employees receive adequate opportunities for training within budgetary allowances prescribed by the council to improve their knowledge and skills the administrator shall act as the approving authority for all requests by city employees to attend conferences meetings training schools etc pertaining to their employment k heshe shall in coordination with the mayor and the city clerk prepare the agenda for all meetings of the council together with such supporting data as may be required provided nothing herein shall be construed to give the administrator authority to limit or prevent matters from being considered by the council the administrator shall attend all meetings of the council boards and commissions assisting the mayor and the city clerk as required in the performance of their duties l heshe shall have charge and management of the city utilities subject to the general control and supervision of the city council rep & recr #880198 m the city administrator shall serve as the manager of all economic development programs of the city and shall be responsible for coordinating the activities of the economic development planning commission established under 143 of this municipal cr #870177 n the city administrator shall have the authority to appoint all heads of departments all subordinate city officials and all city employees with the exception of those appointed under 103 or other sections of this the appointing authority is otherwise specified regardless of by whom appointed the administrator shall have the authority when necessary for the good of the city service to suspend or discharge heads of departments subordinate city officials or employees of the city except as the administrator may authorize the head of a department or office to appoint suspend or discharge subordinates in such department or office cr #960369 5 selection the appointment of the city administrator shall be made solely on merit with due consideration given to hisher training experience ability and general qualifications and fitness for performing the duties of the office 6 cooperation all officers and employees of the city shall cooperate with and assist the city administrator so that the city functions efficiently 112  assessor 1 election and term see 1031 2 applicable statute see 62091 wis stats 3 duties and powers a statutes  see 7012 7013 7017 7018 7023 7029 7030 7032  7034  7035  7043 7044 7045 7048 7049 7050  and  wis stats in particular b other duties prescribed by law  heshe shall perform such other duties as shall be prescribed by state law supervisory personnel of the state department of revenue and the city council including attendance at all meetings of the board of review 113  attorney 1 appointment see 1032 of this chapter 2 qualification the city attorney shall be a member in good standing of the state bar of wisconsin 3 duties the city attorney shall have the duties and responsibilities prescribed in 620912 wis stats and such other duties as the mayor and council may prescribe 4 assistant city attorney am #17o912 notwithstanding the provisions of 620912f the mayor may appoint an assistant city attorney subject to confirmation by the common council who may perform hisher duties and for whose acts heshe shall be responsible to the city and who shall have such other duties as the city attorney may prescribe the assistant city attorney shall be paid such compensation as the council shall determine from time to time 114  building inspector rep & recr #840131 1 building inspection department the building inspection department shall be a division of the engineering department and the building inspector shall be responsible to the city engineer 2 offices of building plumbing and electrical inspector combined the offices of building plumbing and electrical inspector may be combined as provided by 14034 of this municipal the person appointed as building inspector shall perform the duties of each of such offices 115  clerk 1 appointment see 1031 of this chapter 2 duties the clerk shall perform those duties prescribed in 620911 wis stats and such other duties as the council may prescribe 3 deputy the clerk may in writing filed with the mayor and in the office of the clerk appoint a deputy clerk who shall act under hisher direction and in hisher absence or disability and who shall in case of a vacancy perform hisher duties the deputy shall receive such compensation as the council determines 116  comptroller 1 appointment see 1032 of this chapter 2 duties am #870183 the comptroller shall be required to perform only those duties as may be prescribed by resolution of the city council 117  emergency government director 1 appointment see 1032 of this chapter 2 conditions of employment the emergency government director shall receive such salary as may be authorized by the council heshe shall take and file an official oath 3 deputy and assistant directors deputy and assistant directors may be appointed by the director subject to the approval of the emergency government commission such appointees shall receive such compensation as may be determined by the council 4 duties and authority a the director shall be the executive head of the emergency government organization and shall have direct responsibility for the organization administration and operation of such organization subject to the direction and control of the mayor and the council heshe shall coordinate all activities for emergency government within the city and maintain liaison and cooperate with emergency government agencies and organizations of other political subdivisions and of the state and federal governments shall participate in county and state emergency government activities upon request and shall have such additional authority duties and responsibilities as may be determined by the council b the director shall prepare a comprehensive general plan for the emergency government of the city and present such plan to the council for its approval and all emergency government forces of the city shall perform the duties and functions assigned to them by the approved plan the plan may be modified from time to time in a like manner c the director shall in cooperation with city departments affected organize recruit and train any personnel that may be required on a volunteer basis to carry out the emergency government plans of the city and state and conduct such test drills as authorized by the state 118  engineer 1 appointment see 1031 of this chapter 2 duties the city engineer shall perform the duties prescribed in 62147 wis stats and such other duties as the council may prescribe 119  fire chief am #920289 1 appointment and term the fire chief shall be a fulltime officer appointed by the police and fire commission who shall hold office during good behavior subject to suspension or removal by the commission for cause the fire chief shall be under the direct supervision of the director of public safety the director of public safety may also be fire chief 2 general duties the fire chief shall perform such duties as are prescribed in ch 5 of this municipal such other duties as may be prescribed by the director of public safety the city council or both 3 duty of reporting the fire chief shall make annual reports to the director of public safety and the city council on the condition of the fire department and shall recommend to the director of public safety the purchase of such supplies and apparatus for the fire department as may be deemed necessary the fire chief shall in addition to the making of the annual reports to the director of public safety and city council make and attach to each report a brief summary or recapitulation showing activities of the previous year as well as the number and salaries of the members of the department for the previous year 120  police chief am #920289 1 appointment and term the chief of police shall be appointed by the police and fire commission and shall hold office during good behavior subject to suspension or removal by such commission for cause the director of public safety may also be chief of police 2 general duties the chief of police shall perform such duties as are prescribed by ch 4 of this municipal such other duties as may be prescribed by the director of public safety the city council or both 3 duty of reporting the chief of police shall turn over daily to the city treasurer all fees fines receipts and all other moneys received by hisher department heshe shall also make annual reports to the city council and all such other reports as are required of himher by state law and the ordinances of the city the chief of police shall at the time of making hisher report to the council as to the efficiency of the police force include the number of arrests made and the occasions therefor and such other matters as heshe shall embody in hisher reports make and attach to each of such reports a brief summary or recapitulation showing the number of policemen and their respective salaries the total number of arrests made and the occasions therefor and such other matters in brief as heshe deems to be important   director of public safety cr #920289 1 appointment and term the director of public safety shall be a fulltime officer appointed by the police and fire commission who shall hold office during good behavior subject to suspension or removal by the commission for cause the director of public safety may also be the police chief fire chief or both 2 general duties the director of public safety shall administer the police and fire departments and shall be responsible for the government efficiency and general good conduct of such departments the director shall assure that the police and fire chiefs perform the duties required of them by this if the director is also a chief of either or both departments heshe shall perform the duties required of himher in that capacity the director shall have command of the police and fire forces of the city under the direction of the city council the director shall obey all lawful written orders of the city administrator or the city council the director shall also cause the public peace to be preserved and insure that fire suppression and prevention is accomplished enforce all laws and ordinances of the city and statutes of the state of which the police and fire departments must take cognizance and whenever any violation thereof shall come to the directors knowledge heshe shall cause the requisite complaint to be made and procure the evidence for the successful prosecution of the offender 3 powers the director of public safety shall have the power to assign personnel of either or both the police and fire departments to prescribe promulgate and enforce rules and regulations general orders and special orders for the members of the departments which shall however not be inconsistent with the ordinances of the city or the laws of the state 4 appointments and promotions the director of public safety shall make all appointments and promotions in the departments pursuant to 6213 wis stats this authority does not include the appointment of chiefs of the respective departments which pursuant to 62133 wis stats shall be made by the board of police and fire commissioners 5 training the director of public safety shall have the supervision and control of the proper training and education of all members of the departments and may require any or all members to attend selected police and fire training schools or programs for the attainment of the highest possible degree of development and accomplishment in the police and fire departments 6 absence of the director of public safety during the absence of the director of public safety the chiefs of the respective departments if the director is not the chief shall perform all the duties of the director of public safety except to appoint or promote members of the departments or to dismiss personnel commit city resources allocate funds or implement policy if the director of public safety is also a chief the next subordinate officer in rank as established by the rules and regulations of the department shall perform such duties for the department 7 duty of reporting the director shall assure that the duties of reporting required by this municipal the chief of police if heshe is not the chief of police and the fire chief if heshe is not the fire chief be performed 121  public works director of 1 selection the appointment of the director of public works shall be made solely on merit upon the basis of training experience administrative ability efficiency and general qualifications and fitness for performing the duties of the position 2 term see 1031 3 compensation the director of public works shall receive such compensation and expense allowance as the council shall prescribe from time to time 4 other employment prohibited the director of public works shall engage in no other remunerative employment or activity nor shall heshe undertake any professional business industrial or promotional activity for personal pecuniary profit 5 powers and duties the director of public works shall have among others the following powers and duties a public works administration am #850154 subject to the direction of the council and the board of public works if any the director shall be responsible for the administration of all public works and shall have general charge and supervision of all maintenance repair and construction of streets alleys curbs and gutters sidewalks bridges street signs and house numbering traffic control devices signs and markings storm sewers culverts and drainage facilities city buildings and structures where the administration maintenance and repair has not been delegated to others and all machinery and equipment used in any activity under the directors control b sewage heshe shall manage the sewage treatment plant c solid waste heshe shall have charge of such public services as solid waste collection and disposal snow and ice removal street cleaning and flushing lake level control and such other activities as may be assigned to himher from time to time by the council d records heshe shall be responsible for the keeping of all records and documents required by law or ordinance for activities under hisher supervision and all such items shall remain the property of the city e personnel heshe shall appoint subject to the approval of the council all heads of divisions of the public works department heshe shall appoint other personnel of all divisions and activities under hisher supervision all appointments shall be probationary for the first 90 days of continuous employment and shall be made solely on merit upon the basis of training experience ability integrity and general fitness for the duties to be performed f suspension of employment heshe may suspend or remove any city employee under hisher direction and appointed by himher during the probationary periods after the probationary period heshe may suspend or remove any city employee under hisher direction because of insubordination misconduct incompetency inefficiency or failure to perform duties or to observe the rules and regulations applicable to that position any such suspension or removal shall be subject to a hearing before the council if requested in writing by the employee involved and filed with the city clerk within 10 days after such suspension or removal the determination of the council shall be final in each case g reports heshe shall from time to time submit to the council such suggestions and recommendations as heshe believes advisable for the betterment and more efficient operation of the various divisions and activities under hisher supervision not later than february 15 of each year heshe shall submit to the council and the board of public works a written report of all divisions and activities under hisher supervision for the preceding calendar year 123  director of parks and recreation rep & recr #850154 1 appointment and term see 1031 of this chapter 2 duties a general the director of parks and recreation shall implement parks and recreation board policy and supervise programs established by such board the director shall be responsible to the city council b recreation programs the director of parks and recreation shall plan organize publicize supervise and evaluate all programs sponsored or cosponsored by the department the director shall act as advisor for department programs and assure that such programs are conducted within the framework of department policy in addition to conducting established programs the director shall initiate new programs which the director andor the board feel are in the best interests of the city c parks subject to the direction of the city council the director shall have general charge and supervision of all parks and recreational facilities including the maintenance and repair of any structures located therein d trees and plantings the director shall have general charge and supervision of the planting and maintenance of trees and shrubs in parks and on tree borders public streets and other public property see 809 of this municipal e personnel after consultation with the city administrator the director shall advertise for and seek employees deemed necessary for the administration and supervision of city parks and recreation programs the director shall conduct interviews initiate and terminate employment conduct training sessions and evaluate all personnel of the department f budget the director shall be responsible to the board for the income and expenditures of the department and shall operate the department within the funds allotted the director shall annually submit a budget to the board for its analysis and approval the approved budget shall be submitted to the city administrator by august 1 of each year g management of other funds the director shall serve as treasurer for the organizations affiliated with the department or trust funds held by the department the director and secretary shall be bonded city h equipment and supplies the director shall be responsible for the selection purchase storage and maintenance of all equipment and supplies necessary to perform the duties set forth above 124  utilities superintendent of 1 appointment and term am #880198 a superintendent of utilities may be appointed by the council for an indefinite term 2 duties see 1303 of this municipal municipal court and municipal judge rep & recr #17o911 1 municipal court created there is hereby created and established a municipal court under the provisions of ch 755 wis stats for the city of oconomowoc village of oconomowoc lake village of dousman town of delafield village of nashotah town of lisbon town of merton village of sussex village of hartland village of lac labelle town of oconomowoc village of summit village of chenequa town of erin village of merton village of sullivan village of johnson creek contract member town of ixonia contract member and town of ottawa contract member or so many of those municipalities which enact an ordinance identical to this section pursuant to 755014 wis stats 2 municipal judge such court shall be under the jurisdiction of and presided over by a municipal judge who shall be an attorney licensed to practice law in wisconsin and who shall reside in one of the following municipalities city of oconomowoc village of oconomowoc lake village of dousman town of delafield village of nashotah town of lisbon town of merton village of sussex village of hartland village of lac labelle town of oconomowoc village of summit village of chenequa town of erin village of merton village of sullivan village of johnson creek town of ixonia or town of ottawa or those municipalities which enact an ordinance identical to this section and enter into an agreement pursuant to  wis stats for the joint exercise of the power granted under 75501 wis stats such municipal judge shall be elected at large in the spring election for a term of 4 years commencing may 1 all candidates for the position of municipal judge shall be nominated by nomination papers as provided in 810 wis stats and selection at a primary election if such is held as provided in 811 wis stats the town board of the town of delafield shall provide for a primary election whenever 3 or more candidates file nomination papers for such position of municipal judge as provided in 8111a wis stats and such primary election shall be held on the third tuesday of february as provided in 50222 wis stats 3 elections the municipal clerk of each municipality shall see to the compliance with 5581c 5601b 5602 7101a 7604a and 8106bm wis stats to provide for the election of a municipal judge under 755014 wis stats 4 oath and bond the judge shall after his election or appointment to fill a vacancy take and file the official oath as prescribed in 757021 wis stats and at the same time execute and file an official bond in the amount of $500000 the judge shall not act until his oath and bond have been filed as required by 19014c wis stats and the requirements of 755032 wis stats have been complied with 5 salary the salary of the municipal judge shall be fixed by the governing bodies of the municipalities that created and established this municipal court which shall be in lieu of fees and costs no salary shall be paid for any time during hisher term during which such judge has not executed his official bond or official oath as required by 75503 wis stats and filed pursuant to 19014c wis stats the municipalities may by separate ordinances resolutions or budget process allocate funds for the administration of the municipal court pursuant to  wis stats 6 jurisdiction the municipal judge of the municipal court shall have such jurisdiction as provided by  and 75505 wis stats and as otherwise provided by state law the municipal judge is authorized to issue inspection warrants under  wis stats 7 location and hours the municipal court shall be held in the council chambers of the city of oconomowoc city hall at 174 e wisconsin avenue oconomowoc wisconsin the municipal court shall be open at such times as determined by the municipal judge 8 fines and forfeitures the municipal judge may impose punishment and sentences as provided by 80009 wis stats and as provided in the ordinances of the following municipalities city of oconomowoc village of oconomowoc lake village of dousman town of delafield village of nashotah town of lisbon town of merton village of sussex village of hartland village of lac labelle town of oconomowoc village of summit village of chenequa town of erin village of merton village of sullivan village of johnson creek town of ixonia or town of ottawa all forfeitures fees penalty assessments and costs shall be paid to the treasurer of the municipality within which the case arose within 7 days after receipt of the money by the municipal judge or other court personnel at the time of the payment the municipal judge shall report to the treasurer the title of the action the offense for which a forfeiture was imposed and the total amount of the forfeiture fees penalty assessment and costs if any 9 stipulations and deposits in municipal court the municipal court herein established shall be operated pursuant to and in compliance with the provisions of ch 800 wis stats and where applicable other provisions of the wis stats as referred to in subsection 10 below the municipal judge shall establish in accordance with  wis stats a schedule of deposits for violations of city village and town ordinances resolutions and bylaws except traffic regulations which are and shall be governed by 34526 wis stats and boating violations which are and shall be governed by 2366 and 2367 wis stats such deposit schedule shall be approved by the respective governing bodies of the municipalities creating and establishing this court and shall be posted in the office of the municipal court clerk and the police departments of the respective communities 10 procedure in municipal court the procedure in municipal court shall be as provided by this section and state law including but not excluding because of enumeration chs 66 345 751 755 757 and 800 wis stats 11 contempt procedures a the municipal judge may impose a sanction authorized under 800122 wis stats for contempt of court as defined in 785011 wis stats in accordance with the procedures under 78503 wis stats b the municipal judge may impose a forfeiture for contempt under 800121 wis stats in an amount not to exceed $5000 or upon nonpayment of the forfeiture and the penalty assessment under 75705 wis stats a jail sentence not to exceed 7 days 12 the municipal court hereby established shall not be abolished while the 755014 wis stats agreement is in effect boards and commissions 130  architectural commission 1 organization terms a the architectural commission shall consist of 5 members appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council for 2year terms the terms of the members shall be established so that 3 members are appointed in one year and 2 members are appointed in the alternate year the commission shall meet on call am #8056 b at least 3 members of the commission shall be persons who are qualified by experience and training to pass upon design and architecture and upon matters pertaining to building construction and safety an established builder building contractor registered professional engineer practicing in the field of building or building design or a state licensed architect shall qualify as such member am #020533 2 duties the commission shall have the duties as prescribed in  of this municipal am #020533  am #13o841 131  reserved editors note of adopted aug 6 200 repealed 131 which pertained to the board of building appeals 132  capital improvements commission 1 how constituted the capital improvements commission shall be composed of the city administratortreasurer who shall be chairman of the commission and the director of public works mayor planning consultant finance committee and a member of the plan commission who shall be appointed annually by the mayor 2 powers and duties in addition to the responsibilities vested in such commission by the state statutes and the directives of the city council the commission shall recommend methods of financing for the projects in which it is involved 133  electrical commission 1 how constituted the electrical commission shall consist of 5 members appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council the commissioners shall be appointed for 3year terms commencing may 1 in the year in which they are appointed in such manner as to effect the appointment of 3 members one year and 2 members the next year 2 procedure three members of the commission shall constitute quorum for business  but no recommendation for the issuance modification suspension or revocation of a license shall be adopted except by a majority of all members of the commission 3 duties the commission shall have the duties and authority provided in 1430 34  emergency government commission 1 organization the emergency government commission shall consist of the mayor and as many additional members as the council shall determine by resolution such additional members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council and shall serve without compensation the mayor shall serve as chairman of the commission and the emergency government director shall serve as secretary of the commission 2 duties the commission shall be an advisory and planning group and shall advise the mayor the director and the council on all matters pertaining to emergency government the commission shall meet upon the call of the chair 135  library board rep & recr #960365 1 organization  terms a the library board shall consist of 7 members total appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council for 3year terms members shall be residents of the municipality except that not more than 2 members may be residents of towns adjacent to the municipality the school district administrator or the administrators representative shall be a member of such board each term shall commence may l in the year of appointment not more than one member of the council shall at any one time be a member of the board the council exercises the authority granted in 43543 wis stats and provides that the statutorilyrequired 9 members be reduced so that the number of appointive members of the library board is 7 b no compensation shall be paid to the members of the library board for their services except members may be reimbursed for their actual and necessary expenses incurred in performing duties outside the city if so authorized by the library board c a majority of the membership of the library board shall constitute a quorum 2 duties and powers the library board shall have the duties and powers as prescribed in 4358 wis stats 136  plan commission 1 how constituted am #11o794 a the plan commission shall consist of the mayor who shall be its presiding officer the city engineer an alderman and 4 resident citizen members not more than 2 of whom shall reside in the same aldermanic district citizen members shall be persons of recognized experience and qualifications b the alderman member of the commission shall be appointed by the common council in april of each year c the resident citizen members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the common council for 3year terms in such manner as to affect the appointment of at least one of the members every year d plan consultant a plan consultant shall be a nonvoting member of the commission and shall assist the commission in the execution of its powers and duties as prescribed in  of the municipal am #13o841 2 vacancies vacancies other than exofficio shall be filled by appointment for the remainder of the unexpired term in the same manner as appointments for the full term 3 compensation and oath no member shall receive compensation for services on the commission citizen members shall take the official oath required by 1901 wis stats which shall be filed with the city clerk 4 staff the plan commission may employ experts and such staff as may be necessary and may pay for their services and such other expenses as may be necessary and proper within the limits of the budget established by the council or with funds placed at its disposal subject to confirmation of the person or persons so employed by the council and subject further to any ordinance or resolution enacted by the council as far as possible the commission shall utilize the services of existing city officials and employees 137  police and fire commission 1 the police and fire commission shall consist of 5 members 3 of whom shall constitute a quorum the mayor shall annually between the last monday of april and the first monday of may appoint in writing to be filed with the secretary of the commission one member for a 5year term all appointments shall be subject to confirmation by the council no appointment shall be made which will result in more than 3 members of the board belonging to the same political party all members shall be residents of the city and shall maintain residency during their term members of the board shall serve without compensation the board shall keep records of its proceedings am #06o653  #07o704 2 in addition to the members provided for in sub 1 the mayor shall appoint for a term of one year subject to confirmation by the council one alderman to serve with the board as an ex officio nonvoting member 138  public works board of 1 how constituted am #880198 pursuant to 6214 wis stats the city dispenses with the board of public works the duties and powers of such board shall be exercised by the public services committee except as to the city utilities in which case the duties and powers of the board of public works shall be exercised by the city council 2 duties the public services committee when acting as the board of public works shall perform such duties as are prescribed in ch 62 wis stats and such other duties as the council imposes from time to time 139  parks and recreation board rep & recr #850154 1 created  how constituted a there is hereby created an advisory board to oversee the parks and recreation programs of the city which board shall be known as the parks and recreation board the parks and recreation board shall consist of 8 members appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council two members of the board shall be aldermen six members shall be citizens and residents of the city b for continuity of the board initial appointments were for staggered terms two citizen appointments shall be made annually hereafter on the third tuesday of april each for a 3year term the term of the aldermen shall be for one year c the board members shall receive no compensation except expenses unless otherwise provided by ordinance 2 officers and rules a officers am #04o609 the board shall choose from among its members a president and vice president annually in may of each year a staff member of the parks recreation and forestry department shall take minutes of all meetings of the parks and recreation board b rules the board shall adopt rules and regulations necessary to plan promote supervise and regulate all recreational activities to be offered by the city 3 duties the parks and recreation board is empowered and directed a to aid and counsel the director of parks and recreation b to establish recreation programs and set policy for park use c to govern manage control improve and care for all public parks and parkways located within the corporate limits of the city and to secure the quiet orderly and suitable use and enjoyment thereof by the people d the board shall study and develop forms of recreation in public parks playgrounds and other property which may from time to time be placed under its direction by the council the board may negotiate joint contracts with other municipalities subject to council approval 4 quorum a majority of the board members shall constitute a quorum the aldermen on the board shall be entitled to vote on all matters and their attendance shall be counted for purposes of determining a quorum 5 other provisions see 2101 of this municipal board of review 1 appointment am #000468 the board of review shall consist of 5 residents of the city none of whom shall occupy any public office or be publicly employed the members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the council for terms of 5 years and until their successors are appointed and qualified appointment shall be made before june 1 of each year the first appointments shall be staggered so that one appointment is made each year the mayor may appoint an alternate member of the board in addition to the 5 members above provided for who shall act with full power only when a member of the board refuses to vote because of conflict of interest is absent or if a person who is objecting to a valuation requests the removal of a member of the board pursuant to the provisions of 70476m wis stats 2 the board of review must include one voting member who within 2 years of the boards first meeting has attended a training session under 730354 wis stats and unless that member is the mayor or the mayors designee the city clerk shall provide an affidavit to the department of revenue stating whether the requirement under this subsection has been fulfilled am #000468 3 duties the board shall have the powers and duties prescribed in 7047 wis stats 4 confidentiality of information about income and expenses am #990460 whenever the assessor in the performance of the assessors duties requests or obtains income and expense information pursuant to 70477af wis stats or any successor statute thereto then such income and expense information that is provided to the assessor shall be held by the assessor on a confidential basis except however that the information may be released to and used by persons in the discharging of duties imposed by law in the discharge of duties imposed by office including but not limited to use by the assessor in performance of official duties of the assessors office and used by the board of review in performance of its official duties or pursuant to order of a court income and expense information provided to the assessor under 70477af unless a court determines that it is inaccurate is not per 70477af subject to the right of inspection or copying under 19351 wis stats 141  reserved rep #880198 142  board of zoning appeals  rep & recr #05o638 1 establishment and membership a the board of appeals shall consist of 5 members appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation of the common council for terms of 3 years except that of those first appointed one shall serve for one year 2 for 2 years and 2 for 3 years and shall be removable by the mayor for cause upon written charges and after public hearing the mayor shall designate one of the members as chairperson the board may employ a secretary and other employees vacancies shall be filled for the unexpired terms of members whose terms become vacant each member shall serve until hisher successor is appointed and qualified the mayor shall appoint for staggered terms of 3 years 2 alternate members of such board in addition to the 5 members above provided for annually the mayor shall designate one of the alternate members as first alternate and the other as second alternate the first alternate shall act with full power only when a member of the board refuses to vote because of conflict of interest or when a member is absent the second alternate shall so act only when the first alternate so refuses or is absent or when more than one member of the board so refuses or is absent the above provisions with regard to removal and the filling of vacancies shall apply to such alternates b if a quorum is present the board of appeals may take action under this subsection by a majority vote of the members present 2 powers and duties  other provisions see 3 of this municipal am #13o841 143  reserved rep #900245 144  bureau of economic development and tourism commission am #930305  #16o901 1 how constituted a the bureau of economic development and tourism commission shall consist of 5 members the mayor or an alderman the executive director or a member of the chamber of commerce board of directors a representative from the citys hotel and motel industry a representative from the citys retail industry and a representative from the citys food and beverage industry the member of the chamber of commerce shall be a resident of or have business interests within the city am #980426  #16o901 b all vacancies shall filled by appointed in april of each year by the mayor subject to confirmation by a majority vote of the members of the municipalitys governing body who are present when the vote is taken am #16o901 c the term of the mayoralderman shall be for one year the term of all other members shall be for staggered terms commencing on may 1 in the year in which the appointment is made the initial appointments of the nonelected members shall be for the following terms 2 for 3 years one for 2 years and one for one year thereafter the terms of nonelected members shall be 3 years and until their successors are appointed and qualified vacancies shall be filled for an unexpired term am #16o901 d the mayor or alderman shall be chair of the bureau and a member of the city administrative staff shall act as recording secretary for the bureau am #16o901 e no compensation shall be paid to bureau members for services as such but they may be reimbursed for actual and necessary expenses incurred in performing duties outside the city if so authorized by the bureau f the bureau shall adopt rules for its own governance am #16o901 2 director the position of director of the economic development bureau is hereby established the director shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation of the council heshe shall be subject to the personnel policies and procedures of the city and be under the direction and supervision of the city administrator the council shall fix the compensation of the director 3 powers and duties the bureau shall a have exclusive control of the expenditures of all monies donated or appropriated for the bureau b after application and interviews recommend to the mayor in rank order eligible persons to fill the position of director c after giving due consideration to the anticipated tax revenues collected under 308 of this room tax formulate and submit an annual budget pursuant to financial policies and procedures of the city funding for the bureau shall be exclusively from room tax proceeds the city shall not budget nor make payments in excess of the tax collected under 308 of this less administrative expenses no expenditures exceeding the budget approved by the council shall be made without an appropriate fund transfer approved by the council am #16o901 d stimulate promote advertise and publicize tourism to the city and the resort and hotel community e promote travel by visitors to the citys scenic historic natural agricultural educational and recreational attractions am #16o901 f encourage all tourism related businesses to participate in available programs am #16o901 g encourage and cooperate with communities groups and individuals in the county and lake country area in pursuing the tourism promotion objectives of the department am #16o901 h coordinate and stimulate the orderly and ecologically sound development of commercial tourist facilities throughout the city am #16o901 i promote the growth of the tourism and recreation industry planning and assistance am #16o901 j support and assist the efforts of local business and industry the chamber of commerce and other similar public and private agencies to foster expansion of existing commercial and industrial enterprises and initiate efforts to attract new enterprises if within the economic development program plan of the city cr #16o901 k identify for attention of the council those significant business and industrial problems which may be relieved by city action cr #16o901 l assist in the formulation and implementation of integrated economic and community development programs for the city cr #16o901 m annually report to the city administrator on the success of bureau activities cr #16o901 4 transition the change in subsection 1a relating to how the bureau is constituted shall become effective with mayoral appointments in april of 1993 145  community development authority  cr #020530 1 findings of fact the common council of the city of oconomowoc specifically finds and declares that there is a need for blight elimination slum clearance urban renewal and community development programs and projects and housing projects in the city of oconomowoc 2 creation pursuant to  wis stats there is hereby created a community development authority to be known as the community development authority of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin 3 authorization am #040602 the community development authority of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin is authorized to transact business and exercise any and all powers granted to a community development authority under the community development authority law as amended from time to time for the purpose of carrying out blight elimination slum clearance urban renewal programs and projects and housing projects  and authorized also to act as the agent of the city in planning and carrying out community development programs and activities approved by the mayor and common council under the federal housing and community development act of 197 and as agent to perform all acts except the development of the general plan of the city which may be otherwise performed by the plan commission under   to    or  wis stats 4 composition and procedures a  composition  the community development authority shall consist of 7 resident persons having sufficient ability and experience in the fields of urban renewal community development and housing these persons shall be known as commissioners of the community development authority b appointment  am #05o630 the commissioners shall be appointed by the mayor with confirmation by the common council in april of each year terms shall commence on may 1 following appointment two of the commissioners shall be members of the council and shall serve during their term of office as council members the first appointments of the 5 noncouncil members shall be for the following terms 2 for one year and one each for the terms of 2 3 and 4 years thereafter the terms of noncouncil members shall be 4 years and until their successors are appointed and qualified vacancies shall be filled for an unexpired term as provided for in this subsection c chairperson  the community development authority shall annually elect a chairperson and a vicechairperson from among the commissioners d compensation  the commissioners shall receive no compensation for their services but shall be entitled to reimbursement for their actual necessary expenses including local travel expense included in the discharge of their duties e meetings quorum and bylaws  all meetings of the community development authority shall be held in compliance with the provisions of the open meetings law of the state of wisconsin four commissioners shall constitute a quorum for the purpose of conducting its business and exercising its powers and for all other purposes action may be taken by the community development authority upon the affirmative vote of a majority of the commissioners present at any meeting the community development authority may adopt and from time to time amend or repeal such bylaws or other rules or regulations not inconsistent with the applicable laws of the state of wisconsin and of this ordinance as it deems necessary in the performance and function of its duties the initial bylaws and subsequent amendments must also be approved by a majority vote of the common council political boundaries 150  aldermanic districts  rep & recr #01o507  am #11o807 pursuant to 62081 wis stats and within 60 days after the wards of the
