unless permitted under 5236 of this chapter c occupational safety and health administration   portable fire extinguishers 2  definitions applicable to this subpart 4 bureau of fire prevention and investigation a supervision  the bureau of fire prevention and investigation the bureau shall be operated under the supervision of the fire chief b assignment of department personnel  the fire chief shall assign such other department personnel to the bureau as shall be necessary to enforce the regulations of this subchapter c chief inspector appointed  the fire chief shall appoint a chief inspector to the bureau d recommendation of experts  the fire chief may recommend to the council the employment of technical experts and other personnel if required who when such authorization is made shall be selected examination by the board of police and fire commissioners to determine their fitness for the positions e enforcement  the chief and personnel of the bureau shall enforce the regulations of this subchapter and all other laws lawful orders and ordinances relating to the following 1 the prevention of fires 2 the storage sale use and handling of combustibles and explosives 3 the installation and maintenance of fire alarm systems and fire protection equipment appliances and devices 4 the maintenance of fire escapes as means of egress 5 the means adequacy and maintenance of exits from all buildings structures or other places in which numbers of persons live sleep work or congregate from time to time for any purpose 6 the investigation of the causes origins and circumstances of fires f reports  1 a quarterly report of the activities of the bureau shall be made and transmitted to the fire chief and shall contain statistics and other information required by him 2 an annual report containing all information on matters regulated by this subchapter together with statistics and such other information as may be required shall be made and transmitted by the bureau to the fire chief 3 the bureau shall make such reports as may be required by the state department of industry labor and human relations g duties  the bureau shall perform such other duties as are set forth in this subchapter state statutes lawful orders of the state department of industry labor and human relations the ordinances and directives of the city and all additional duties prescribed by the fire chief 5 liability for damages this subchapter shall not be construed to hold the city responsible for any damage to persons or property by reason of the inspection or reinspection authorized herein or failure to inspect or by reason of the approval or disapproval of any equipment authorized herein 516  reserved rep #860157 517  automatic fire extinguishing equipment required for food serving establishments 1 generally every kitchen operated and maintained to serve the public including restaurants clubs schools churches taverns hospitals nursing homes and all other places having equipment used for frying cooking and similar preparation of food shall be equipped with automatic fire extinguishing equipment 2 protection of cooking surfaces open or partly open cooking surfaces shall be protected including range tops fat fryers open broilers griddles etc fully enclosed devices such as ovens enclosed broilers coffee urns steam tables etc do not require protection 3 applications and approval all applications for installation of automatic fire extinguishing equipment shall be submitted for review and approval by the fire prevention bureau prior to installation two sets of plans and specifications shall be submitted to the fire prevention bureau for review one set shall be retained by the fire department and the other returned to the installer and if approved shall be stamped conditionally approved bureau of fire prevention with the date of such approval final approval shall be subject to actual installation and inspection 4 time for compliance of new and existing establishments all new establishments subject to this section shall comply herewith before a permit of occupancy is granted by the building inspector all existing establishments subject to this section shall comply herewith not later than   provided if the requirement to comply with this section by  will result in practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship the owner or person having control of such existing establishment may within 10 days after receiving notice from the fire inspector to comply appeal to the building board of appeals for a variance from the terms and conditions of this section 5 type of equipment and installation requirements all equipment and installations shall conform to the nfpa no 96 standards for installation of equipment for the removal of smoke and grease laden vapors from commercial cooking equipment fire extinguishing equipment the term the authority having jurisdiction as stated in the nfpa be interpreted to mean the fire department 6 maintenance and use requirements all the maintenance and use of automatic fire extinguishing equipment shall conform to nfpa no 96 procedures for the use of and maintenance of equipment 518  reserved rep #860157 519  reserved rep #860157 fire hydrant requirements 520  fire hydrant requirements 1 purpose the purpose of this section is to insure an adequate water supply for fire fighting purposes to structures or buildings located in private property at extended distances from city hydrants 2 private installations a when required when substantial portions of a building are set back 250 feet or more from the street or highway or more than 300 feet from a city hydrant the owner shall install at hisher expense approved water hydrants hydrants shall be freestanding and installed not more than 50 feet nor less than 25 feet from the building hydrants shall be provided around the perimeter of the building so that no part of the building is more than 300 feet from any hydrant measured by normal access routes hydrants shall be within 10 feet of an all weather surfaced road b exception paragraph a shall not apply to singlefamily and duplex dwellings 3 approved water hydrant defined an approved water hydrant is a water hydrant connected to a city water main with 2 212 inch hose connections and one 412 inch hose connection all to have nst threads the connecting water line between the city water main and the approved hydrant shall not be less than 6 inches all water hydrants shall be approved by the fire prevention bureau and city water department and shall be installed in such a manner and location as to be accessible at all times to the fire department 4 construction specifications underground water mains hydrants and valves shall conform to current specifications 5 tests the water utility shall make such tests as may be required by the national fire protection association such tests shall be conducted under the supervision of a utility representative who shall certify acceptance or rejection of the system 6 time for compliance and new and existing establishments all new establishments subject to this section shall comply therewith before a permit of occupancy is granted by the building inspector all existing establishments subject to this section shall comply not later than   provided if the requirement to comply with this section by  will result in a practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship the owner or person having control of such existing establishment may within 10 days after receiving notice from the fire inspector to comply appeal to the building board of appeals for a variance from the terms and conditions of this section 521  permits certificates of approval inspections and appeals 1 compliance required am #860157 no building permit shall be issued for a building which does not conform to the provisions of 520 of this chapter two copies of the plans and specifications detailing standpipe hydrant sprinkler or substitute systems designed by a licensed designer of fire protection systems or a professional engineer or architect shall be submitted for an approval one copy of the plans and review report shall be returned to the chief building inspector and one copy kept on file in the bureau of fire prevention inspections of systems and determinations of compliance with this subchapter and the approved plans shall be made by the bureau of fire prevention 2 appeals a whenever the bureau of fire prevention disapproves an application or the chief of fire department requests a revocation the applicant may appeal the decisions to the building board of appeals within 30 days of the date of the decision appealed from b whenever the applicant claims that the provisions of this subchapter do not apply to the structure in question or that the intent and meaning of this subchapter have been misconstrued or wrongly interpreted heshe may appeal the decision to the building board of appeals within 30 days of the decision appealed from 3 permit revocations a request for revocation the chief or fire prevention bureau may request the building department to revoke any permit issued under this subchapter where the chief or bureau finds that any of the conditions of issuance have not been maintained or where there has been any false statement or misrepresentation of any material fact in the application or plans on which the issuance was based b notice and hearing the chief or fire prevention bureau shall promptly notify the permit holder of the request for revocation  and if requested by the permit holder the effective date of the revocation shall be deferred pending a hearing before the fire chief and the bureau of fire prevention the decision of the chief or the fire prevention bureau for revocation following the hearing shall be final  except the permit holder may appeal the decision to the building board of appeals within 30 days under ch 68 wis stats c appeals all appeals shall be in the form of a written notice served on the city in which the questioned decision is fully stated such notice shall be at once transmitted to the board which shall arrange for a hearing thereon such written notice shall be accompanied by such fee as the council decides payable to the city regardless of the outcome of the appeal such fee shall be retained by the city and no refund of such fee or any portion thereof shall be granted 522  storage handling and use of flammable of combustible liquids 1 application the provisions of this section shall apply to all persons storing handling or using flammable or combustible liquids and to all places where the same are stored handled or used 2 restricted locations a no person shall store any receptacle containing fuel for internal combustion engines within a dwelling unit including basements crawl spaces and attics for the purpose of this paragraph receptacles include any tank or device attached to any equipment using an internal combustion engine as a source of power such as lawn mowers snowmobiles snowblowers chain saws motorcycles etc b for the purpose of storing internal combustion engines private garages attached to or made a part of a principle dwelling unit with a resistive enclosure shall be exempt from the provisions of par a above provided not more than 10 gallons of fuel shall be stored c no person shall store class 1 liquids in aboveground tanks outside of buildings within the city except a permit may be issued for temporary installations in industrial districts or parcels of land larger than one acre used for single family residences or for permanent installation in industrial districts provided the installation is in compliance with the requirements of ch ilhr 10 wis adm the requirements of of this municipal am #920298 d no bulk plants shall be constructed within the city except in industrial districts and then only if the bureau of fire prevention has approved the proposed location with respect to topography nearness to places of public assembly and adequacy of water supply for fire control and only if the installation thereof is in compliance with the requirements of ch ilhr 10 wis adm the requirements of of this municipal am #920298 3 retroactivity existing plants stores equipments buildings structures and installations for the storage handling or use of flammable or combustible liquids which are not in strict compliance with the terms of this section may be continued in use provided these do not constitute a direct hazard to life and property when the chief of the bureau of fire prevention sees that the continued use will constitute a clear hazard to life and property heshe shall notify the owner or operator to discontinue such use and specify the reason in writing 4 permits required a permit issued pursuant to this section shall be obtained from the bureau of fire prevention for any of the following a storage handling or use of class i liquids in excess of 10 gallons in a dwelling or other place of human habitation or in excess of 20 gallons outside of any building  except no permit shall be required for the following 1 the storage or use of flammable or combustible liquids in the fuel tank of a motor vehicle aircraft motorboat mobile power plant mobile heating plant or domestic heating appliance 2 storage or use of paints oils varnishes or similar flammable mixtures when such liquids are required for maintenance painting or similar purposes for a period of not more than 30 days b storage handling or use of class ii or class iii flammable liquids in excess of 20 gallons in a building or in excess of 60 gallons outside a building c storage of flammable or combustible liquids in stationary tanks whether above ground or below d manufacture processing building blending or refining of flammable or combustible liquids e abandonment or removal of underground tanks which have contained flammable or combustible liquids 5 inspection and approval a application for a permit required hereunder to construct or erect facilities for the storage handling or use of flammable liquids or combustible liquids shall be made in writing to the bureau of fire prevention the bureau shall then cause the premises and equipment proposed to be used to be inspected if they are found to be in compliance with this section a statement to that effect shall be made on the application and the application shall be signed by the person making the inspection the bureau of fire prevention shall thereupon grant the permit b before operating any equipment or storing any flammable or combustible liquids or covering the underground portions of any such equipment for which a permit is required notice shall be given to the bureau of fire prevention and the bureau shall within 2 working days cause such premises or equipment to be inspected c the bureau of fire prevention may at any reasonable time inspect premises buildings installations or equipment for the storage handling or use of flammable or combustible liquid if a violation of this section is found written notice shall be filed with the owner occupant or operator citing the violation and ordering its correction if such order is not complied with within a reasonable time the bureau of fire prevention may suspend the permit for such facility d containers tanks equipment and apparatus meeting the standards of nationally recognized inspection or test laboratories shall be considered as meeting the requirements of this section 523  miscellaneous provisions 1 decorative materials am msc 86 a decorative materials such as flammable window draperies curtains streamer surface coverings applied over the building interior finish for decorative acoustical or other effect and also cloth cotton batting straw vines leaves and plastics used for decorative effect except floor coverings and ordinary window shades shall not be permitted in the following occupancies in such buildings fabric decorations where used shall be flameproofed and so maintained by the owner or occupant of the building am #900233 1 assembly over 100 ch ilhr 55 wis adm  2 educational ch ilhr 56 wis adm  3 institutional ch ilhr 57 wis adm  b where carpeting is used for purposes other than floor covering such as attached to walls ceilings and similar uses the carpeting shall be approved by the fire prevention bureau of the city as having a flame resistant or similar characteristic this carpeting shall have a flame spread rating of 75 or less when tested in accordance with the rules of ilhr  wis adm for the manufacturer for each specific product 2 waste materials a no owner agent or occupant of any building situated within the city shall allow to accumulate any waste materials such as paper hay straw rags or other waste materials of combustible nature in any building or on any premises more than 24 hours unless stored as provided by par b below the fire prevention bureau shall order the immediate removal of such accumulated combustible waste material from any building or premises when in their opinion such storage would create a fire hazard ashes when kept in basements of buildings under this section shall be placed in fireproof bins areas or containers b combustible cuttings disposal of waste cloth paper or other waste shall be cleaned up and removed from the building at the close of each days work and shall be stored in a separate fireproof storage building in a metal container with cover a metal lined box with cover or a fireproof vault or room 3 gas shutoff gas appliances every gas supply main shall have a service cock outside of the building so placed and maintained that it can be shut off at any time without entering the building the use of flexible armored gas tubing shall be limited to portable devices and no more than 4 feet of length of such tubing shall be used as a connection to any portable device there shall be but one shutoff valve and that shall be on the gas pipe to which such tubing is attached 4 no smoking a it shall be unlawful to light a match or other flameproducing device or to smoke carry a lighted cigar cigarette or pipe in any retail merchantile establishment except in areas approved for such purposes by the fire prevention bureau it shall be the duty of the person in charge of such establishment to enforce the regulations of this section b smoking is prohibited in all rooms or parts of buildings which contain flammable liquids in open containers or in which the vapors from flammable liquids are present or in which flammable liquids are used in any manufacturing process c in all areas where smoking is prohibited suitable signs lettered no smoking shall be displayed d any person who by smoking or attempting to light or to smoke cigarettes cigars pipes or tobacco in which lighter or matches are employed who shall in a careless reckless or negligent manner whether willfully or wantonly or not set fire to any bedding furniture curtains draperies  house or any household furnishings or any part of any building shall be guilty of violating this 5 use of oxyacetylene torches any person desiring to use oxyacetylene torches for cutting any metal on any premises and in or on any building shall first make application for permission to do so to the fire prevention bureau the application for such permission shall set forth the location of the premises where the work is to be done and a description of the work to be done before such oxyacetylene torches are used proper protection of surrounding shall be made by the use of asbestos blankets or other fire resistive materials a fire extinguisher pails of water or small hose attached to a water supply shall be conveniently located close to the cutting operations such other precautions shall be taken as ordered by the fire prevention bureau this section shall not apply to business establishments when such oxyacetylene torch is used in connection with regular business operations such establishments shall use the same precautions to prevent fires as required of persons who must obtain a permit 6 open burning prohibited cr #900252 notwithstanding the provisions of 1410 wis adm adopted by reference in 5153a of this chapter no person shall kindle or maintain open burning or authorize the kindling or maintaining of open burning within the city limits except for the following purposes a outdoor cooking b training for fire departments c bonfires for special events subject to the regulations of  wis adm bonfire means a large open air fire kindled to mark a public event victory celebration or similar occurrence where dry combustible material such as wood paper and similar items are burned see 1401 wis adm building construction and demolition operations in addition to complying with the provisions of of this municipal the following shall be complied with 1 combustible materials a no lumber from boards or other combustible construction materials in excess of 2500 cubic feet shall be delivered to any construction site unless there is a hydrant or other source of water satisfactory to the fire chief conveniently available for extinguishing fire therein b all combustible materials stored on the site awaiting use in construction operations shall be piled in an orderly manner with suitable separation between piles 2 access a all construction and demolition operations shall be so conducted as to maintain at all times convenient routes of access to make all parts of the structure accessible to the fire department for fire fighting operations b in all buildings over 50 feet in height at least one stairway shall be maintained usable at all times this stairway shall be extended upward as each floor is installed in construction operations and in demolition operations such stairway shall be maintained in usable condition at least to the floor level next below the topmost remaining parts of the building 525  building and occupancy permits 1 building permits prior to issuance of a building permit the building inspector shall secure in writing from the fire prevention bureau written requirements relating to fire safety measures of proposed development developers shall submit one set of plans for the fire prevention bureau use this shall apply to all new buildings in the city excluding the construction of one and 2family dwellings and appurtenant structures change of use or modifications of existing buildings or structures shall follow the same procedure 2 occupancy permits before any building or vacant land is occupied or used an occupancy permit or temporary occupancy permit shall be issued by the building inspector prior to the issuance of an occupancy permit or temporary occupancy permit excluding one and 2family dwellings the fire prevention bureau shall certify in writing to the building inspector that a thorough inspection has been made of the premises and all required systems are installed and functioning properly 526  rapid entry system cr #880200 1 required all new multifamily of 3 or more units commercial or manufacturing structures shall provide a public safety key box system for fire department use the key box shall contain keys for elevator return and door opening elevator rooms fire alarm box fire alarm box room electric rooms and any other key necessary for access to the structure for emergency fire and rescue purposes this requirement shall apply to all structures existing on the effective date of this section if there is a change in its alarm or suppression system 2 installation key box systems may be surface mounted or flush mounted in an easily accessible location the key box shall be located not less than 5 feet nor more than 8 feet above grade in the event locks are changed in any of the above mentioned rooms the fire department shall be notified immediately the key box shall be a type approved by the fire chief 530  penalties 1 any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter or any regulation rule or order made hereunder shall be subject to a penalty as provided by 2504 of this municipal 2 compliance with the provisions of this chapter may also be enforced by injunctional order at the suit of the city or one or more owners of real estate situated adjacent to an area in violation of the regulations of this chapter chapter 6  emergency government operations 601 emergency government 602 emergency government commission 603 emergency government director 604 utilization of existing services and facilities 605 declarations of emergency 606 emergency regulations 607 mutual aid agreements 608 identification cards 609 continuity of government 614 prohibited discharges 615 obstruction of emergency government organization 620 penalty 601  emergency government 1 policy and purpose a emergency government means the preparation for and the carrying out of all emergency functions other than functions for which the military forces are primarily responsible to minimize and repair injury and damage resulting from disaster caused by enemy attack sabotage or other hostile action or by fire flood or other natural causes b by reason of the increasing possibility of disasters of unprecedented size and destructiveness and to insure that preparations will be adequate to cope with such disasters to provide for the common defense to protect the public peace health safety and general welfare and to preserve the lives and property of the people it is hereby declared necessary 1 to establish a local emergency government organization  2 to provide for the exercise of necessary powers during emergencies  and 3 to provide for cooperation and mutual aid between the city and other political subdivisions 2 further it is the purpose of this chapter and the policy of the city to coordinate all emergency government functions of the city to the maximum extent practicable with existing services and facilities of the city and with comparable functions of the federal state and county government and other political subdivisions and of various private agencies to the end that the most effective preparation and use may be made of manpower resources and facilities for dealing with any disaster that may occur 602  emergency government commission see 134 of this emergency government director see 119 of this utilization of existing services and facilities in preparing and executing the emergency government plan the director shall utilize the services equipment supplies and facilities of the existing departments and agencies of the city to the maximum extent practicable the officers and personnel of all such departments and agencies shall cooperate with and extend such services and facilities to the director 605  declarations of emergency the emergency government organization shall take action in accordance with the emergency government plan only after the declaration of emergency and issuance of official disaster warnings declarations of emergency shall be made by the governor the council or the mayor or in hisher absence the director upon such declaration of emergency the director shall issue all necessary proclamations as to the existence of such state of emergency and shall issue such disaster warnings or alerts as are required in the emergency government plan such state of emergency shall continue until terminated by the issuing authority provided any declaration not issued by the governor may be terminated by the council 606  emergency regulations whenever necessary to meet an emergency for which adequate regulations have not been adopted by the city council the mayor or in hisher absence the director may by proclamation promulgate and enforce orders rules and regulations relating to the conduct of persons and the use of property which are necessary to protect the public peace health and safety to preserve lives and property and to insure cooperation in emergency government activities such proclamations shall be posted in 3 public places and may be rescinded by resolution of the city council 607  mutual aid agreements the director may subject to the approval of the council enter into mutual aid agreements with other political subdivisions copies of such agreements shall be filed with the secretary of the state department of emergency government 608  identification cards 1 no person shall have or maintain any card or other device used to identify himher as a member of the emergency government organization unless such person is a bona fide member in good standing of the appropriate service of the emergency government organization for which the card or device has been issued 2 no person shall represent himself as a member or representative of the city emergency government organization unless such person is a bona fide member 609  continuity of government 1 each city officer and department head shall designate a successor and one alternate successor to perform hisher duties and exercise hisher powers only when such officer or department head is unable because of an emergency hereunder to attend to hisher duties and exercise hisher powers in person each city officer and department head shall file with the city clerk and the emergency government director a list showing the name and address of such successor and alternate successor 2 during the absence of any city officer or department head by reason of an emergency hereunder such successor or alternate successor shall have all of the powers and perform all of the duties of the officer or department head whom heshe replaces for the duration of the emergency 3 every city officer and department head shall take steps toward the preservation of all records which heshe is bound to keep by law 614  prohibited discharges cr #900239 1 prohibited discharges no person shall discharge or cause to be discharged leaked leached or spilled upon any public or private street alley public or private property  onto the ground surface waters subsurface waters or aquifers  or within the city except those areas specifically licensed for waste disposal or landfill activities and to receive such materials  any explosive flammable or combustible solid liquid or gas  any radioactive material at or above nuclear regulatory restriction levels  etiologic agents  or any solid liquid or gas creating a hazard potential hazard or public nuisance or any solid liquid or gas having a deleterious effect on the environment 2 containment cleanup and restoration any person in violation of subsection 1 shall upon direction of any emergency government officer begin immediate actions to contain clean up and remove to an approved repository the offending material and restore the site to its original condition with the offending person being responsible for all expenses incurred should any person fail to engage the necessary personnel and equipment to comply or to complete the requirements of this section the office of emergency government may order the required actions to be taken by public or private resources and allow the recovery of any and all costs incurred by the city as action imposed by sub 3 3 emergency services response emergency services response includes but is not limited to fire service emergency medical service and law enforcement a person who possesses or controls a hazardous substance which is discharged or who causes the discharge of a hazardous substance shall be responsible for reimbursement to the responding agencies for actual and necessary expenses incurred in carrying out their duties under this section actual and necessary expenses may include but not be limited to replacement of equipment damaged by the hazardous material cleaning decontamination and maintenance of the equipment specific to the incident costs incurred in the procurement and use of specialized equipment specific to the incident specific laboratory expenses incurred in the recognition and identification of hazardous substances in the evaluation of response decontamination cleanup and medical surveillance and incurred costs in future medical surveillance of response personnel as required by the responding agencies medical advisor 4 site access access to any site public or private where a prohibited discharge is indicated or suspected will be provided to emergency government officers and staff and to city police and fire department personnel for the purpose of evaluating the threat to the public and monitoring containment cleanup and restoration activities 5 public protection should any prohibited discharge occur that threatens the life safety or health of the public at near or around the site of a prohibited discharge and the situation is so critical that immediate steps must be taken to protect life and limb the coordinator of emergency government coordinators assistant senior police or fire official or the incident commander on the scene of the emergency may order an evacuation of the area or take other appropriate steps for a period of time until the city council can take appropriate action incident commander shall be determined under the provisions of the incident command system set forth in title 49 federal registry 6 enforcement the coordinator of emergency government and the coordinators deputies as well as the city policy officers shall have authority to issue citations or complaints under this section 7 civil liability any person in violation of this section shall be liable to the city for any expenses incurred by the city and for loss or damage sustained by the city by reason of such violations 8 penalties any person in violation of this section shall forfeit to the city upon conviction thereof not less than $50000 plus the costs of prosecution and in default of payment thereof be imprisoned in the county jail for not more than 90 days each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense 615  obstruction of emergency government organization no person shall willfully obstruct hinder or delay any member of the emergency government organization in the enforcement of any order rule regulation or plan issued pursuant to this chapter or violate any order rule regulation or plan issued pursuant to the authority contained in this chapter 620  penalty except as otherwise provided herein any person found in violation of any provision of this chapter or any order rule or regulation made hereunder shall be subject to a penalty as provided in 2504 of this municipal  traffic code 701 state traffic laws adopted  state statutes adopted  state standards for motor vehicle equipment adopted during snowstorm emergencies 708 stopping or standing of vehicles prohibited 709 taxicab stands 710 parades processions and assemblages 711 snowmobiles 712 bicycles 713 school bus warning lights 714 operation of motor vehicles on premises held out to the public for use of their vehicles 715 compression brakes prohibited 716 neighborhood electric vehicles permitted 717 atv regulations 720 penalty 721 enforcement 701  state traffic laws adopted cr #820104 except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter the statutory provisions in chs 340 to 348 wis stats describing and defining regulations with respect to vehicles and traffic exclusive of any provisions therein relating to penalties to be imposed and exclusive of any regulations for which the statutory penalty is a fine or term of imprisonment are adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any statute incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this chapter any future amendments revisions or modifications of the statutes incorporated herein are intended to be made part of this chapter in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of traffic on the highways streets and alleys of the state   state statutes adopted cr #820104 the statutory provisions in 94101 wis stats reckless driving off highways exclusive of any provisions therein relating to penalties to be imposed and exclusive of any regulation for which a statutory penalty is a fine or term of imprisonment is hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by this statute is required or prohibited by this chapter any future amendments revisions or modifications of this statute are intended to be made part of this chapter in order to secure uniform statewide regulation   state standards for motor vehicle equipment adopted rep & recr #980431 1 administrative regulations adopted the administrative rules and regulations of ch trans 305 wis adm exclusive of any provisions therein relating to the penalties to be imposed are hereby adopted by reference and made part of this if fully set forth herein 2 limitation a law enforcement officer may not stop or inspect a vehicle solely to determine compliance with ch trans 305 wis adm law enforcement officer may issue a citation for a violation of ch trans 305 wis adm observed in the course of a stop or inspection made for other purposes except that a law enforcement officer may not take a person into physical custody solely for a violation of ch trans 305 wis adm 3 noncompliance prohibited no person shall operate or allow to be operated on any highway street or alley within the city a vehicle that is not in conformity with the requirements of subsection 1 of the equipment provisions of ch 347 wis stats or ch trans 305 wis adm 4 owners liability any owner of a vehicle not equipped as required by this section who knowingly causes or permits such vehicle to be operated on a highway is guilty of the violation the same as if heshe had operated the vehicle the provisions of 34704 wis stats relating to nonapplicability of demerit points shall apply to owners convicted of violation of this section 5 penalty penalty for violation of any provision of this section including the provisions of ch trans 305 wis adm incorporated herein by reference shall be as provided in 2504 of this municipal with the costs of prosecution and applicable penalty assessment   speed limits cr #8063  am #10o779 pursuant to ch 213 and 349113c wis stats the speed limits are decreased on the following streets or portions thereof 1 residential district as defined by 3400150 wis stats none 2 outlying areas a twentyfive miles per hour 1 concord rd from the south city limits north to the residential areas 2 lapham st between its intersection with lake bluff drive and cth z north to its terminus b thirtyfive miles per hour  cr #86o156 silver lake street from bolson drive south to the city limits 702  oneway streets safety zones and regulated turns at intersections the city council under the authority granted by 34910 wis stats may designate oneway streets and safety zones may regulate and prohibit right or left turns at street and alley intersections and may prohibit or allow uturns at areas not covered by state law 703  parking limitations rep & recr #97o385  rep & recr #16o888 1 no parking areas the chief of police may establish no parking areas or limit parking in certain areas and blocks in the city upon the posting of signs giving notice of such parking limitations such limitations shall be in full force and effect and no person shall stop or leave any vehicle standing upon any portion of a highway at the time when parking is prohibited limited or restricted 2 allnight parking prohibited am #12o814 no person shall park any vehicle between  am and  am on any day from december 1 to march 1 in any street in the city except with express permission of the police department signs giving notice of this restriction shall be placed or erected at or near the city limits on all state and county trunk highways and connecting streets 3 parking limited no person shall park a vehicle on any city street alley or highway within an area with posted parking limitations except in compliance with such limitations 4 parking of semitrailers and trucks no person shall park a semitrailer or tractor truck as defined in 3400157 and 3400173 wis stats on any street or alley within the city except during the process of loading or unloading such vehicle 5 parking of trailers prohibited a parking of trailers detached from motor vehicles is prohibited on all city streets and public areas unless in an area designated for trailer parking this subsection shall not apply to temporary parking for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading or in receiving or discharging passengers and well attended so it can be moved in case of emergency or to avoid obstructing traffic b parking of trailers attached to motor vehicles is prohibited on all city streets and public areas where continuous in excess of 48 hours 6 stopping standing or parking prohibited in parking spaces reserved for vehicles displaying special registration plates or a special identification card except for a motor vehicle used by a physically disabled person as defined under 1 wis stats no person may park stop or leave standing any vehicle whether attended or unattended and whether temporarily or otherwise upon any portion of a street highway or parking facility reserved by official traffic signs indicating the restriction for vehicles displaying special registration plates issued under 341141 1a 1e 1m 1q or 1ra wis stats or a special identification card issued under 34351 wis stats or vehicles registered in another jurisdiction and displaying a registration plate card or emblem issued by the other jurisdiction which designates the vehicle as a vehicle used by a physically disabled person 7 stopping standing or parking outside of business or residence districts a no person shall park stop or leave standing any vehicle whether attended or unattended upon the roadway of any highway outside a business or residence district when it is practical to park stop or leave such vehicle standing off the roadway but even parking stopping or standing of a vehicle off the roadway of such highway is unlawful unless the following requirements are met 1 an unobstructed width of at least 15 feet upon the roadway of such highway must be left opposite such standing vehicle for the free passage of other vehicles this section shall not apply to a school bus when the school bus is loading or unloading pupils or other authorized passengers where red flashing signal lights are used as required by 346482 wis stats 2 such standing vehicle must be capable of being seen by operators of other vehicles from a distance of 500 feet in each direction along such highway 8 stopping prohibited in certain specified places a no person shall stop or leave standing any vehicle whether attended or unattended and whether temporarily or otherwise in any of the following places 1 within an intersection 2 on a crosswalk 3 between a safety zone and the adjacent curb or within 15 feet of a point on the curb immediately opposite the end of a safety zone unless a different distance is clearly indicated by an official traffic sign or marker 4 on a sidewalk or sidewalk area except when parking in such place is clearly indicated by official traffic signs or markers 5 alongside or opposite any highway excavation or obstruction when such stopping or standing would obstruct traffic or when pedestrian traffic would be required to travel in the roadway 6 on the roadway side of any parked vehicle unless double parking is clearly indicated by official traffic signs or markers 7 within 15 feet of the driveway entrance to a fire station or directly across the highway from such entrance 8 upon any portion of a highway where and at the time when stopping or standing is prohibited by official traffic signs indicating the prohibition of stopping or standing 9 within 25 feet of the nearest rail at a railroad crossing 9 parking prohibited in certain specified places no person shall stop or leave any vehicle standing in any of the following places except temporarily for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading or in receiving or discharging passengers and while the vehicle is attended by a licensed operator so that it may promptly be moved in case of an emergency or to avoid obstruction of traffic a in a loading zone b in a fire lane c in an alley in a business district d within 10 feet of a fire hydrant unless a greater distance is indicated by an official sign e within 4 feet of the entrance to an alley or a private road or driveway f closer than 15 feet to the near limits of a crosswalk 10 other restrictions on parking and stopping am #01o504 a  parking without consent  no person may leave or park any motor vehicle on private property without the consent of the owner or lessee of the property b  parking on posted property  owners or lessees of public or private property may permit parking by certain persons and limit restrict or prohibit parking as to other persons if the owner or lessee posts a sign on the property indicating for whom parking is permitted limited restricted or prohibited no person may leave or park any motor vehicle on public or private property contrary to a sign posted thereon c overnight parking  am #06o651 no person firm partnership or corporation nor any officer member or agent servant or employee of any firm partnership or corporation may leave or park any motor vehicle in any public parking lot during hours during which parking is prohibited signs shall be required notifying the public of the hours during which parking is prohibited no person firm partnership or corporation nor any officer member or agent servant or employee of any firm partnership or corporation may leave or park any motor vehicle in any public parking lot overnight in those parking lots where parking permits are available without first obtaining a parking permit from the city of oconomowoc police department parking permits shall authorize parking between the hours of  pm and  am the following morning in permit parking areas only permits shall be issued according to the following procedures 1 application for a parking permit shall be made to the police department and shall contain the name and address of the vehicle owner and the registration number of the vehicle for which the permit is intended parking permits shall be for a calendar year or monthly 2 annual permits may be purchased for a calendar year upon payment prior to february 1 if purchased on or after february 1 a monthtomonth permit shall be issued if issued after the 14th day of any month the fee for that month shall be approximately half the monthly rate in the event the original permit is lost or stolen a duplicate permit may be issued for a fee no part of any permit fee shall be refundable am #01o510  #07o690  #07o713  #08o735  #09o765  #13o847 current fees remain in effect until amended by the common council the parking permit fees shall be set by resolution of the common council 3 the allnight parking permit shall permit parking from  pm to  am of the following morning 4 the allnight parking permit shall be issued by the police department upon receipt of a properly completed application and payment of the fee therefor the permit shall be issued only to the vehicle owner no more than one overnight parking permit may be issued to any dwelling unit for purposes of this subsection dwelling unit shall mean a singlefamily residence or unit in a multifamily residence  apartments 5 calendar year permits or permits prorated for a calendar year shall be of one color and monthly permits shall be a different color permits shall bear such information as in the opinion of the police department is necessary for identification purposes when in use the permit shall be attached by peeling off the backing and affixing the permit decal to the inside upper corner of the rear window on the drivers side if display of a permit in the rear window is not possible the permit should be placed on the inside lower corner of the windshield on the drivers side this alternate location may be used only if the vehicle does not have a rear window has a louvered rear window has a deeply tinted rear window or has a rolldown rear window station wagons 6 certain parking lanes within municipal parking lots may be designated as restricted areas for permitted parking only all such lanes shall be marked permitted parking area in addition to any hourly restrictions that might ordinarily apply 7 no person firm partnership or corporation nor any officer member or agent servant or employee of any firm partnership or corporation may leave or park any motor vehicle in any permit parking area between the hours of  pm and  am the following morning without having first obtained a parking permit from the city of oconomowoc police department d prohibited practices  no person firm partnership or corporation nor any officer member agent servant or employee of any firm partnership or corporation shall park any vehicle of any kind or description in an area reserved for permitted parking when such vehicle is displaying a forged counterfeited or duplicated city of oconomowoc night parking permit any object mimicking the appearance of such a permit or any such permit which has been issued for a vehicle other than the one upon which it is displayed any penalty imposed under this subsection shall be in addition to any forfeiture imposed for violation of parking regulations e penalty  1 any person who violates any of the provisions of 70310c shall upon conviction of such violation be subject to the following penalty a forfeiture of not less than $2500 for the first offense $3500 for the second offense $5500 for the third offense and $5500 for each separate offense thereafter during any calendar year each violation and each day a violation continues or occurs shall constitute a separate offense am #04o596  #08o735  #09o765 2 any person who shall violate any of the provisions of 70310d shall upon conviction of such violation be subject to a penalty as provided in 720 of the municipal f temporary parking restrictions  cr #12o815 1 street maintenance when it is necessary to clear repair or reconstruct a city street or any part thereof the contractor performing the work andor the department of public works shall post such street or part thereof with signs bearing the words no parking  towaway zone such signs shall also contain the datestimess the street will be closed for maintenance such signs shall be erected at least 24 hours prior to the time that street maintenance work is to be commenced no person shall park a motor vehicle in violation of such signs in the event the owner or operator parks or allows to remain parked a motor vehicle in violation of such signs the vehicle shall be towed away at the discretion of the police department pursuant to 70312 the owner or operator of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for removing towing or any storage charge involved the contractor andor the department of public works shall notify the police dispatch of the time the signs are posted 2 emergency maintenance if the work to be performed is in response to an emergency the department of public works will request the police department to assist in making notification to the owneroperator of such vehicle in an attempt to remove such vehicle if the owneroperator cannot be located the vehicle shall be towed away at the discretion of the police department pursuant to 70312 the owner or operator of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for removing towing or any storage charge involved 3 special events a pursuant to the provisions of 34913 and  wis stats the chief of police is authorized to direct temporary no parking signs be erected by the department of public worksevent organizers during parades festivals and other authorized events that require the regulating of vehicles stopped standing or parking on city streets the temporary regulations shall be limited to the time the event exists or is likely to exist no parking signs shall be erected no later than 8 hours before the event is to commence and shall be removed within one hour after the event such signs shall contain the datesstimess the street will be closed for the event event organizers shall notify the police dispatch of the time the signs are posted b it is acknowledged vehicles may be parked along city streets prior to the erection of no parking signs required for special events owners or operators of such vehicles shall upon appropriate signs being placed andor notification by the police department immediately remove their vehicle vehicles parking in violation of the no parking restriction during special events are subject to being towed away at the discretion of the police department pursuant to 70312 the owner or operator of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for removing towing or any storage charge involved 11 exceptions the exceptions set forth to stopping and parking restrictions in subsections 7 11 contained in 34650 wis stats are adopted by reference and shall apply to the above subsections of this ordinance 12 towing and immobilizing parked vehicles cr #12o815 a towing of parked vehicles  any vehicle parked in violation of the wisconsin statutes or contrary to the restrictions prohibitions and limitations of this or any other provision of the municipal may be towed additionally vehicles may be towed as deemed necessary for snow removal highway maintenanceconstruction special events or in the interest of public safety including but not limited to situations in which the parked vehicle is blocking traffic or otherwise creating an emergency the police department shall facilitate towing under this section the owner or operator of the vehicle removed shall pay the reasonable charges for removing towing or any storage charge involved 704  weight limitations 1 class b highways designated all streets and alleys within the city except the following streets and alleys are hereby designated class b highways and shall be subject to the weight limitations imposed by 34816 wis stats a all state trunk highways and connecting streets and all county trunk highways unless otherwise designated by the waukesha county board 2 special and seasonal weight limitations the director of public works may impose special or seasonal weight limits to prevent injury to the roadway of any highway bridge or culvert within the city or for the safety of users of such highway bridge or culvert and shall be responsible for erecting signs giving notice thereof in accordance with 34916 wis stats 705  reserved  editors note of o779 adopted  repealed  705 which had pertained to regulation of alleys 706  official traffic signs and signals 1 procurement and erection of signs and signals the director of public works shall procure erect and maintain appropriate standard traffic signs signals and markings conforming to the rules of the state highway division of the department of transportation giving notice of the provisions of this chapter as required by state law signs shall be erected in such locations and in such manner as the chief of police determines will best effect the purposes of this chapter and give adequate warning to users of the streets and highways 2 removal of unofficial signs and signals the chief of police shall have the authority granted by 34909 wis stats and shall cause the removal of a sign signal marking or device placed maintained or displayed in violation of this chapter or 34641 wis stats any charge imposed on a premises for removal of such an illegal sign signal or device shall be reported to the council at its next regular meeting for review and certification 707  parking during snowstorm emergencies  1 no person shall park or leave standing any vehicle upon any uncleared street during or after a snowstorm so as to interfere with the operation of snow removal police fire or ambulance equipment unless it is physically impossible to move such vehicle 2 the director of public works or any of hisher employees acting under hisher direction shall remove any vehicle which interferes with or may interfere with the operation of snow removal police fire or ambulance equipment and charge the cost of removal and storage of such vehicle to the owner thereof 708  stopping or standing of vehicles prohibited in addition to the parking limitations provided for in 703 the stopping or standing of vehicles on city streets other than in marked parking areas is prohibited except when due to temporary breakdown or when necessary to comply with traffic regulations or directions to avoid accidents or trucks unloading merchandise to stores in the downtown business area of the city 709  taxicab stands the council may designate certain parking areas as taxicab stands and all other parking is prohibited in such marked areas 710  parades processions and assemblages subject to 84074 wis stats no parades processions or assemblages shall be permitted upon any street or highway within the city unless a permit therefor is obtained from the chief of police the chief of police may establish routes time limitations and other reasonable regulations in granting such permit and may refuse to grant such permit if the same is against the public welfare safety or good of the city 711  snowmobiles 1 state snowmobile laws adopted am #820104 except as otherwise specifically provided in this chapter the statutory provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to snowmobiles in the following enumerated sections of the wisconsin statutes are hereby adopted by reference and made part of this section as if fully set forth herein acts required to be performed or prohibited by such statutes are required or prohibited by this section any future amendments revisions or modifications of the statutes incorporated herein are intended to be made part of this chapter in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of snowmobiles 2 applicability of rules of the road to snowmobiles the operator of a snowmobile upon a roadway shall in addition to the provisions of ch 350 wis stats be subject to 34604 34606 34611 346141 34618 34619 34620 34621 34626 34627 34633 34635 34637 34639 34640 34644 34646 34647 34648 346501b 34651 34652 34653 34654 34655 34687 34688 34689 34690 34691 346921 and 346941 6 6m and 9 wis stats 3 age limitation there shall be no age limitation for the operation of a snowmobile except no person under the age of 12 shall drive a snowmobile across any highway or street and no person under the age of 16 shall drive a snowmobile across any state trunk highway or connection street thereto 4 permitting operation by improper persons prohibited no owner or person having charge or control of a snowmobile shall authorize or permit any person to operate such snowmobile who is not permitted under state law to operate such snowmobile or who is under the influence of an intoxicant or a dangerous or narcotic drug 5 operation while under influence prohibited wis stats shall apply to the operation of a snowmobile any place within the city 6 races derbies parades sporting events a permit required  no snowmobile race derby parade or other group event shall be held nor shall nay person participate in any such event in the city unless a permit has been issued therefor by the council b permit  a permit issued hereunder shall specify the area to be used by participants in such event or the route to be taken which area or route shall be clearly marked by the permit holder the council shall issue the permit only if upon recommendation of the police department the event can be conducted safely and without danger to persons or property and without creating a public nuisance c application  application for such permit shall be filed with the city clerk 2 weeks before the planned event 7 written consent of owner required no person shall operate a snowmobile upon or across the lands of another including public or school lands whether open or enclosed without the consent of the owner of such lands hisher agent or the person lawfully in possession or charged with control thereof the consent required hereunder shall be written consent dated and limited to the year in which the consent is given if the property is owned or leased by more than one person the consent of each shall be obtained 712  bicycles 1 state laws adopted the provisions of chs 340 to 349 and other wisconsin statutes now in force or which may be enacted in the future as amendatory or supplementary thereto pertaining to the rules of the road and the regulation andor operation of bicycles are adopted as a portion of this section so far as applicable except as otherwise provided by this section 2 rules for riding rn #970386 a state laws adopted  the statutory provisions describing and defining regulations with respect to bicycles in the following enumerated sections of the wisconsin statutes exclusive of any provision therein relating to the penalties to be imposed or the punishment for the violation of such statutes are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this section as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any statute incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this section 34677 responsibility of parent or guardian for violation of bicycle regulations 34679 special rules applicable to bicycles 34680 riding bicycle on roadway 34681 lamps and other equipment on bicycles b feet not to be removed from pedals  no person shall operate a bicycle on the city streets with hisher feet removed from the pedals c trick riding prohibited  no rider of a bicycle shall remove both hands from the handle bars or practice any trick or fancy riding in any street d riding two abreast  persons riding bicycles upon any public street shall not ride more than 2 abreast except in a general parade or public demonstration e riding on sidewalks  no person shall operate a bicycle on any sidewalk in the city except in districts zoned residential or for the purpose of learning the operation of a bicycle 3 forfeiture rn #970386 any person who shall violate any provision of this section shall upon conviction thereof pay a forfeiture of not more than $2500 together with costs of prosecution and on default of payment of such forfeiture and costs may be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid but not exceeding 90 days 713  school bus warning lights cr #8050 in addition to the requirements specified in 34748 wis stats the operator of a school bus shall use the flashing red warning lights in residence or business districts when pupils or other authorized passengers are to be loaded or unloaded where a sidewalk and curb are laid on both sides of the roads 714  operation of motor vehicles on premises held out to the public for use of their vehicles  cr #880196 1 this section shall apply to all premises held out to the public for use of their motor vehicles whether such premises are publicly or privately owned and whether or not a fee is charged for the use thereof this section shall not apply to any street or highway 2 no person shall operate a motor vehicle on such premises a across parking stalls indicated by painted lines this section shall not prohibit entering and occupying a parking stall nor exiting the same if the operator properly remains within the painted lines b in a manner commonly known as spinning doughnuts wherein the vehicle is driven rapidly in a tight radius c at a rapid or sudden acceleration the squealing of tires or leaving of tire marks shall be evidence of rapid or sudden acceleration d the wrong way in a driving lane where such wrong way is indicated by painted arrow or by the entry angle of adjoining parking stalls or left of a marked centerline in a driving lane e without stopping for a stop sign posted on such premises the stop required hereunder shall be complete and of sufficient duration to allow adequate observation of the possible approach of other vehicles or pedestrians before proceeding with safety a rolling stop or a momentary stop shall not comply with the provisions hereof f at a speed in excess of posted limits g at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions and having regard for the actual and potential hazards then existing the speed of a vehicle shall be so controlled as may be necessary to avoid colliding with any object person vehicle or other conveyance on such premises and in compliance with legal requirements and using due care 3 no person shall park stop or leave any vehicle standing whether attended or unattended and whether temporarily or otherwise upon any of the following designated areas of such premises a upon any portion of such premises where and at the time when parking stopping or standing is prohibited by appropriate signs indicating the prohibition of any parking stopping or standing am #09o743 b upon any portion of such premises marked as a fire lane c except for a motor vehicle used by a physically disabled person as defined under 1 wis stats upon any portion of such premises reserved by official traffic signs indicating the restriction for vehicles displaying special registration plates which designates the vehicle as a vehicle used by a physically disabled person d upon any portion of premises designated for vehicular parking by painted lines striping which identifies parking stalls by parking the vehicle beyond the limit of a stall so as to encroach on another stall or upon the traffic lanes of the premises cr #09o743 715  compression brakes prohibited  cr #08o723 1 no operator of a motor vehicle shall use brakes which are in any way activated or operated by the compression of the engine of the motor vehicle or any unit or part thereof commonly referred to as jake brakes jacobs brakes engine brakes or compression brakes on any state trunk or county trunk highway within the city of oconomowoc except in cases of emergency for purposes of this section cases of emergency are defined as circumstances which present an immediate danger to life or property 2 emergency vehicle exceptions the prohibition set forth in subsection 1 of this section shall not apply to authorized emergency vehicles as that term is defined by 340013 wis stats when responding to an emergency call when in pursuit of an actual or suspected violator of the law or when responding but not upon returning from a fire alarm 716  neighborhood electric vehicles permitted  cr #09o742 1 definition a neighborhood electric vehicle nev means a selfpropelled motor vehicle that has successfully completed the neighborhood electric vehicle of america test program conducted by the federal department of energy and which conforms to the definition and requirements for lowspeed vehicles as adopted in the federal motor vehicle safety standards for lowspeed vehicles under 49 cfr 5713b and  neighborhood electric vehicle does not include golf carts 2 requirements nevs shall be fourwheeled and have a speed range of at least 20 mph and not more than 25 mph on a paved surface and have a gross vehicle weight at rest of less than 2500 pounds nevs shall have a head lamps b front and rear turn signals c stop lamps d reflex reflectors one red on each side as far to the rear as practicable and one red on the rear 3 total e an exterior mirror mounted on the drivers side and either an exterior mirror on the passenger side or an interior rearview mirror f a parking brake g a windshield that conforms to the requirements of the federal motor vehicle safety standard on glazing materials 49 cfr  h a vehicle identification number vin that complies with federal law 49 cfr 565 i a type 1 or type 2 seatbelt assembly conforming to 49 cfr  and federal motor vehicle safety standard no 209 for each designated seating position j meets the general test conditions under 49 cfr  3 permitted users of neighborhood electric vehicles to use an nev on city streets the operator must have a valid wisconsin drivers license 4 operation operation of an nev within the city of oconomowoc is permitted on municipal roadways and alleys subject to the following prohibitions a operation of an nev is prohibited on any connecting state trunk highway including the state trunk highway 6716 bypass except for crossing the state trunk highway 6716 bypass at lexington drive old tower road and armour road b operation of an nev is prohibited on any roadway with a speed limit greater than 30 mph c operation of an nev is prohibited on any municipal sidewalk or recreational trail d operation of an nev is prohibited within any municipal park golf course or recreational area except on a roadway or parking area routinely open to motor vehicle traffic e headlamps must be on at all times during operation of an nev on city streets 5 operational requirements of neighborhood electric vehicles nevs shall comply with all state and local traffic laws including but not limited to of the municipal ordinances and owners and operators of nevs shall be subject to citations and forfeitures for any violations 6 registration nevs operated within the city of oconomowoc shall be registered with the wisconsin department of transportation and shall display that registration in accordance with ch 341 wis stats 7 enforcement any person who violates any provision of this section shall be subject to a forfeiture as provided in 720 of this chapter 8 severability if any portion of this ordinance or its application to any person or circumstances is held invalid the validity of this section as a whole or any other provision herein and its application to other persons or circumstances shall not be affected editors note o742 adopted  enacted provisions designated as 715 inasmuch as there exists a section so designated said provisions have been redesignated as 716 to avoid duplication 717  atv regulations  cr #12o838 1 definitions the definitions found in 23331 wis stats are hereby adopted by reference 2 atvs may be operated with a snow removal device attached on roadways or adjacent to roadways during the period beginning on october 1st and ending on april 30 of each year for the purpose of removing snow if such operation is necessary to travel to or from a site where a snow removal device will be used the travel necessary to or from the site for intended snow removal may not exceed 2 miles 3 atv equipment requirements a the atv shall comply with the regulations found at 2333 wis stats and any other applicable administrative b the atv shall have a slow moving vehicle placard that complies with  wis stats and trans 304 wis adm affixed to the rear c a person who operates an atv with a snow removal device attached as authorized is required to display at least one or more flashing or rotating amber or yellow lights and at least one of these lights shall be visible from every direction d the atv shall have a snow removal device attached to the atv the device may be a plow blade blower bucket or brush 4 atv snow removal requirements a the atvs headlamp amber flashing lamp and taillights must be in operation during snow removal operations at all times b snow removal equipment must be in good working condition c atvs may be used during the snow removal process as well as to travel the distance necessary from location to location to remove snow except as noted below d when operating on sidewalks the atv shall yield to pedestrians shall not exceed five miles per hour and shall not use the sidewalk for travel purposes from location to location e operators may operate only on roadways where the motor vehicle speed is 45 mph or less and may operate only on the extreme righthand side of the road and then no faster than 15 mph f atv operators are prohibited from depositing snow on city streets g an atv operator shall comply with all other applicable laws not in conflict with this section h no person who is under 16 years of age may operate an atv under the authorization provided under the wisconsin statutes or this section under any circumstances i no person may operate an atv with a snow removal device attached on any part of any freeway under any circumstances 5 exception these regulations do not apply to an atv utilized for snow removal in which the atv remains completely on the atv owners property 6 penalties violations of this section shall be penalized as provided in 2504 of the municipal penalty  rep & recr #970385 the penalty for violation of any provision of this chapter shall be a forfeiture and penalty assessment if required under 16587 wis stats a jail assessment if required by 53461 wis stats plus any applicable fees prescribed in ch 814 wis stats 1 uniform offenses forfeitures for violation of any provision of  wis stats shall conform to the forfeiture permitted to be imposed for violation of the statutes adopted by reference including any variations or increases for subsequent offenses provided the forfeiture for violation of any provision of   and  wis stats shall be not less than $5000 nor more than $50000 2 special local regulations a the forfeiture for violations of 702 except 712 of this chapter shall be as provided in 2504 of this municipal b the penalty for violation of 712 shall be as provided in 7127 721  enforcement  am msc 90 1 procedure this chapter shall be enforced according to 2333 6612 34511 to 34561 and ch 800 wis stats 2 uniform citation the uniform traffic citation promulgated under 34511 wis stats shall be used for all moving traffic violations under this chapter 3 parking citations citations for all nonmoving traffic violations under this chapter shall conform to 34528 wis stats and shall permit direct mail payment of the applicable minimum forfeiture to the city police department within 5 days of the issuance of the citation in lieu of court appearance the issuing officer shall specify on the citation the amount of the applicable forfeiture as provided in this chapter 4 notice of demerit points and receipt every officer accepting a forfeited penalty or money deposit under this chapter shall give a receipt therefor in triplicate as provided in 345263b wis stats the deposit shall include applicable costs and assessments every officer accepting a stipulation under the provisions of this chapter shall comply with the provisions of 345261a and 34328 wis stats and shall require the alleged violator to sign a statement of notice in substantially the form contained on the uniform traffic citation and complaint promulgated under 34511 wis stats 5 forfeitures in treasury  officer to post bond  qualify any officer accepting deposits or forfeited penalties under this chapter shall deliver them to the city administratortreasurer within 20 days after receipt any officer authorized to accept deposits under 34526 wis stats or this chapter shall qualify by taking the oath prescribed by 1901 wis stats and filing an official bond in the sum of $100000 as described by 1901 wis stats chapter 8  public works 801 sidewalk and curb and gutter construction 802 sidewalk improvement program 803 street improvement program 804 street excavations 805 sidewalk openings 806 street obstructions and use 807 damage to streets prohibited 808 snow and ice removal 809 rep #000467 810 house numbering 811 storm sewer assessment 812 special assessment procedure 813 regulation of the application and use of fertilizers 815 penalty 801  sidewalk and curb and gutter construction 1 construction every sidewalk or curb and gutter built or rebuilt in the city shall be constructed and placed as provided in this chapter or by the terms of any ordinance or resolution relating to particular sidewalks a permit required  no person shall construct lay or rebuild any sidewalk or curb and gutter on any public street avenue lane alley concrete driveway or square within the city without having first obtained a permit therefor from the city engineer provided any person under contract with the city shall be exempt from this requirement permits issued hereunder shall be issued to the property owner who shall be responsible for compliance with this section b performance of contractors  the permit holder shall do all work required in the construction laying or rebuilding of any sidewalk or curb and gutter in a substantial manner and shall furnish material and workmanship of such high grade and quality that no settlement or defect in the sidewalk or curb and gutter will be apparent at any time within one year from the date of the work any defects occurring within one year shall be repaired by the permit holder at hisher own expense in a manner satisfactory to the city engineer c sidewalk location  all sidewalks shall be laid one foot from the street rightofway line and shall be a minimum of 4 feet wide extensions of existing sidewalks shall conform to the width and location of the existing sidewalk within the block d curb and gutter standards  all street curbing built or rebuilt in the city shall be constructed of cement concrete in accordance with specifications prescribed by the city engineer e sidewalk standards  all sidewalks constructed in the city shall be of cement concrete laid to the established grade with a slope toward the gutter line of 14 of an inch per foot such sidewalks shall be constructed in a good substantial manner in accordance with the specifications prescribed by the city engineer 2 use no person shall except when crossing at a constructed driveway a obstruct a sidewalk so as to prevent or impede its use for pedestrian purposes b place goods wares or merchandise on a sidewalk or suspend any such goods over a sidewalk for sale or show except the owner of an abutting store or building may use not more than 3 feet of the sidewalk extending from hisher building or store for such purpose c obstruct a sidewalk with goods wares or merchandise being loaded or unloaded for more than 6 hours and within 3 feet of the roadway line along the edge of the sidewalk 802  sidewalk improvement program 1 program created it is determined to be in the public interest of the city that a permanent sidewalk improvement program be instituted and effected by the city 2 scheduling of improvements the permanent sidewalk improvement program shall be based upon the scheduling of permanently improving certain sidewalks in the city as called for on an annual scheduled basis such permanent improvement shall be based upon such standards as may be set from time to time and such improvements shall be paid for in accordance with  wis stats this section shall not prevent the right of the city to request and demand separate sidewalk repairs or maintenance not included in the annual schedule of such improvement program 3 new sidewalks the council may from time to time in accordance with such annual schedule order the installation of new sidewalks based upon standards set by the city 4 responsibility of owner the abutting owner shall build repair construct and perpetually maintain sidewalks along or upon any street alley or highway in the city and shall pay the entire cost thereof whenever the council by resolution determines a sidewalk will be laid rebuilt repaired lowered or raised along or upon any public street alley or highway within the city it shall proceed according to  wis stats 5 standards the board of public works upon recommendation of the city engineer subject to confirmation by the council shall set the standards for the sidewalk improvement program such standards may be changed from time to time in accordance with appropriate engineering criteria 803  street improvement program 1 program created following an appropriate study conducted by the city council including advisory survey and advisory public hearing it is determined to be in the public interest of the city that a permanent street improvement program be instituted and effected by the city 2 scheduling and funding the permanent street improvement program shall be based upon the schedule of permanently improving certain streets in the city as called for on an
