hearing and a transcript of all testimony presented at the hearing shall also be presented to the council in the event the hearing is conducted by a hearing officer the common councils decision shall be by a written decision approved by a majority vote and based on the preponderance of the evidence in the event the hearing is conducted by a hearing officer the licensee shall receive written notice of the date time and location at which the common council will consider the hearing officers report in all cases the city and the licensee shall have the opportunity to make closing arguments to the common council based on all the evidence testimony and documentation presented on the claimed violation the common councils written decision may adopt in whole or in part the hearing officers report the licensee shall have the right to immediately seek judicial review of the common councils determination pursuant to subsection 9c b the common council shall revoke a license if it determines after a hearing that 1 a licensee gave false or misleading information in the material submitted during the application process 2 a licensee has knowingly allowed possession use or sale of alcohol or controlled substances on the premises 3 a licensee has knowingly allowed prostitution on the premises 4 a licensee knowingly operated the sexually oriented business during a period of time when the licensees license was suspended 5 a licensee has knowingly allowed any act of sexual intercourse sodomy oral copulation masturbation or other sex act to occur in or on the licensee premises c if the common council revokes a license the revocation shall continue for one year and the licensee shall not be issued a sexually oriented business license for one year from the date the revocation became effective if subsequent to revocation the common council finds that the factual basis for the revocation did not occur the applicant may be granted a license d after a revocation of any license the licensee may seek prompt judicial review per subsection 9c 12 transfer of license a licensee shall not transfer his or her license to another nor shall a licensee operate a sexually oriented business under the authority of a license at any place other than the address designated on the license 13 hours of operation no sexually oriented business may remain open at any time between the hours of  am and  am 14 sale use or consumption of alcoholic beverages prohibited a the sale use or consumption of alcoholic beverages on the premises of a sexually oriented business is prohibited b any violation of this section shall constitute a violation of this section 15 age requirement a no person under the age of 18 shall enter the establishment of a sexually oriented business b an owner operator employee or licensee of a sexually oriented business shall not permit a person under 18 years of age to be employed by or to enter the establishment c a sexually oriented business shall at all times cause the entrance of the establishment to be so attended as to insure compliance with the requirements contained herein 16 nudity at sexually oriented businesses prohibited no person shall knowingly or intentionally in a sexually oriented business appear before a patron or patrons in a state of nudity any sexually oriented business which is found in violation of this section shall have its license suspended pursuant to the provisions of subsection 10 17 unlawful activities nothing contained in this section is intended or shall be construed to permit or authorize activities which are unlawful under state law or city ordinance it is unlawful and a violation of this section for an operator to knowingly or intentionally violate the provisions of this section or to allow either knowingly or intentionally an employee or a patron to violate the provisions of this section it shall be a defense to prosecution that the person prosecuted was powerless to prevent the violation 18 regulations pertaining to exhibition of sexuallyexplicit films videos or live entertainment in video rooms booths or cubicles a a person who operates or causes to be operated a sexually oriented business which exhibits on the premises in a viewing room booth or cubicle of less than 150 square feet of floor space a film video cassette live entertainment or other video reproduction which depicts specified sexual activities or specified anatomical areas shall comply with the following requirements 1 upon application for a sexually oriented license the application shall be accompanied by a diagram of the premises showing a plan thereof specifying the location of one or more managers stations and the location of all overhead lighting fixtures and designating any portion of the premises in which patrons will not be permitted a managers station may not exceed 32 square feet of floor area the diagram shall also designate the place at which the permit will be conspicuously posted if granted a professionally prepared diagram in the nature of an engineers or architects blueprint shall not be required  however each diagram should be oriented to the north or to some designated street or object and should be drawn to a designated scale or with marked dimensions sufficient to show the various internal dimensions of all areas of the interior of the premises to an accuracy of plus or minus 6 inches the city may waive the foregoing diagram for renewal applications if the applicant adopts a diagram that was previously submitted and certifies that the configuration of the premises has not been altered since it was prepared 2 the application shall be sworn to be true and correct by the applicant 3 it is the duty of the licensee of the premises to ensure that at least one employee is on duty and situated in each managers station at all times that any patron is present inside the premises 4 the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view from a managers station of every area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose excluding restrooms restrooms may not contain video reproduction equipment if the premises has 2 or more managers stations designated then the interior of the premises shall be configured in such a manner that there is an unobstructed view of each area of the premises to which any patron is permitted access for any purpose from at least one of the managers stations the view required in this subsection must be by direct line of sight from the managers station 5 it shall be the duty of the licensee to ensure that the view area specified in subsection 4 remains unobstructed by any doors curtains partitions walls merchandise display racks or other materials and at all times to ensure that no patron is permitted access to any area of the premises which has been designated as an area in which patrons will not be permitted in the application filed pursuant to subsection 1 of this section 6 no viewing room may be occupied by more than one person at any time 7 the premises shall be equipped with overhead lighting fixtures of sufficient intensity to illuminate every place to which patrons are permitted access at an illumination of not less than 5 footcandles as measured at the floor level 8 it shall be the duty of the licensee to ensure that the illumination described above is maintained at all times that any patron is present in the premises 9 no holes shall be allowed in the walls or partitions which separate each viewing room from an adjoining viewing room or restroom no licensee shall allow openings of any kind to exist between viewing rooms or booths 10 the licensee shall during each business day regularly inspect the walls between the viewing booths to determine if any openings or holes exist 11 all floor coverings in viewing booths or rooms shall be nonporous easily cleanable surfaces with no rugs or carpentry carpeting all wall surfaces and ceiling surfaces shall be constructed of or permanently covered by nonporous easily cleanable material all floor and wall coverings shall be cleaned on a daily basis so as to keep them free from semen urine feces needles and trash no wood plywood composition board or other porous material shall be used within 48 inches of the floor 19 exemptions the provisions of this section do not apply to the following a theaters performing arts centers civic centers exhibition halls restaurants dinner theaters and similar establishments where live dance ballet music and dramatic performances of serious artistic social or political expression are offered to the general public with or without paid admission  or movie theaters video arcades or other places offering theatrical performances where video or motion picture presentations of dance ballet music and dramatic performances of serious artistic social or political expression are offered to the general public with or without paid admission b lavatories restrooms and bathrooms on the licensed premises where there is unintentional exposure of genitals by individuals performing excretory functions or dressing rooms during an employees bona fide use of a dressing room which is accessible only to employees c the private areas or guest rooms not accessible to the general public of those hotels motels rooming houses or bed and breakfast businesses in the city which hold an operators license under ch 125 wis stats or the municipal d the rental or sale of video cassettes dvd videodiscs or other electronic media for private viewing by individuals off the licensed premises e exposure of any portion of the female breast while a person is engaged in breastfeeding a child f in a modeling class operated 1 by a college junior college or university supported entirely or partly by taxation  2 by a private college or university that maintains and operates educational programs in which credits are transferable to a college junior college or university supported entirely or partly by taxation  or 3 in a structure a which has no sign visible from the exterior of the structure and no other advertising that indicates a nude person is available for viewing  b where in order to participate in a class a student must enroll at least three days in advance of the class  and c where no more than one nude model is on the premises at any one time 20 penalty  equitable remedies a any violation of any provision of this section or any lawfully issued order of the zoning administrator plan commission common council or their designated representative issued in pursuance of this section shall be a municipal civil infraction as described in 2504 of the municipal day that a violation is permitted to exist or occur and each separate occurrence shall constitute a separate offense b any premises building dwelling or other structure in which a sexually oriented business is repeatedly operated or maintained in violation of the provisions of this section shall constitute a public nuisance and shall be subject to civil abatement proceedings initiated by the city of oconomowoc in a court of competent jurisdiction each day that a violation is permitted to exist or occur shall constitute a separate operation or maintenance of the violation c notwithstanding the above subsections the city may employ any remedy available at law or in equity to prevent or remedy a violation of any provision of this section a person who operates or causes to be operated a sexually oriented business without a valid license or in violation of this section is subject to a suit for injunction as well as prosecution for violations of such ordinance such violations shall be punishable by a forfeiture as set forth in 2504 of the municipal day a sexually oriented business so operates is a separate offense or violation 21 severability this section and its various parts sections subsections sentences phrases and clauses are declared to be independent and severable notwithstanding any other evidence of legislative intent it is hereby declared to be the controlling legislative intent that if any part section subsection sentence phrase or clause or the application thereof to any person or circumstance is adjudged unconstitutional or invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction the remaining sections or provisions and the application of such sections and provisions to any person or circumstances other than those to which it is held invalid shall not be affected thereby and it is hereby declared that such sections and provisions would have been passed independently of such section or provision so held to be invalid 22 repeal all ordinances or orders in conflict in whole or in part with any of the provisions of this section are to the extent of such conflict repealed 1220  penalty am msc 90 in addition to the revocation suspension or nonrenewal of any license issued under this chapter any person found to be in violation of any provision of this chapter shall be subject to a penalty as provided in 2504 of this municipal  municipal utilities rep and penalties 1369 creation of communications utility penalties 1370 penalties general 1301  city utilities am #000480 the waterworks systems electric light and power distribution systems and communications systems of the city are combined and are regulated by the public service commission of wisconsin the citys wastewater treatment facility and systems are not combined with the electric water and communications utilities and are not regulated by the public service commission of wisconsin the waterworks systems electric light and power distribution systems the wastewater treatment facility and systems and the communications systems are enterprise funds and operated as the city of oconomowoc utilities 1302  operation 1 common council a management  management and control of the city utilities shall be vested in the common council acting as the board of public works who shall have the powers and perform the functions of public utility commissions as prescribed by state statutes b rates and regulations  am #000480 the common council shall from time to time by adoption of appropriate ordinances or resolutions classify the type of electric service available to customers define the availability of electric water and communications services establish schedules of rates for electric water and communications services provide conditions for delivery of electric current water service and communication services and promulgate such other rules and regulations it deems necessary and proper for the operation of the city utilities subject to control by the public service commission of wisconsin as provided by wisconsin statutes 2 supervision the city administrator shall supervise the operation of the utilities under the general control and supervision of the common council see 111l 3 utility committee a appointment  as provided in  207 of this municipal the utility committee shall consist of 3 aldermen appointed by the mayor without council approval at the first meeting of the council in may of each year but vacancies thereafter may be filled by the presiding officer of the council any member of the committee may be removed by resolution adopted by a vote of a majority of the members of the council the mayor shall designate the chairman and secretary of the committee b authority of utility committee  the utility committee shall make recommendations to the common council concerning the operation of the city utilities 4 operations manager am #10o781 a appointment  as provided by 1032 of this municipal the mayor may appoint a operations manager subject to confirmation to the council the operations manager shall receive such salary as the council may direct the managers term of employment is indefinite b duties  the following duties and responsibilities in the operation of the city utilities shall be performed by the operations manager who shall report to the city administrator 1 the operations manager shall be responsible for the daytoday operations of the city utilities shall supervise the operation and interests of the city utilities and shall supervise the city utilities buildings machinery and anything connected therewith the operations manager shall be responsible for directing coordinating and expediting the activities of the city utilities 2 the operations manager shall see that the bylaws rules and regulations of the council are executed 3 the operations manager shall see that the conditions of all contracts by or with the city utilities are faithfully complied with 4 the operations manager shall make a quarterly and annual report of the condition and the operation of the city utilities 5 the operations manager shall appoint after consultation with the city administrator and subject to approval of the common council all employees necessary to conduct the business of the city utilities such employees shall hold their positions at the discretion of the operations manager 6 the operations manager shall prepare the agenda for all committee meetings and shall distribute said agenda and such supporting data as may be required 7 the operations manager shall perform such other duties in relation to the city utilities as the city administrator or the common council may direct 5 finance director am #000480 utility duties  the following duties and responsibilities in the operation of the city utilities shall be performed by the finance director who shall report to the city administrator 1 the finance director shall see that the assessment of the water sewer electric and communications charges are made receipted for and paid into the appropriate utility general fund 2 the finance director shall keep all records pertaining to the management of the city utilities in books provided for that purpose such records shall show names of all consumers description of premises supplied uses to which water supply is put rate of tariff collections made and such other items as the council may require 3 the finance director shall examine all accounts and claims approve the same if correct and submit them to the finance committee 4 the finance director shall develop budgeting procedures and supervise in the preparation of an annual budget for the city utilities the operations manager in cooperation with the finance director shall be responsible for coordinating financial and economic data for the city utilities longrange plan am #10o781 1303  service territory 1 policy as a matter of policy the service territory of the city utilities should be at least coextensive with the city limits and those customers and residents within the city should as a condition of being within the city obtain all their governmental services from the city other rate payers and taxpayers within the city fund these services for the benefit of all city residents city residents and customers should not be able to pick and choose which municipal services they wish to support and which they wish to obtain elsewhere 2 electric and water service territory  residents requirement the city utilities shall serve all persons within the city limits except as may be modified pursuant to subsection 5 hereof all persons residing within the city limits and all business entities located within the city limits are hereby required to obtain their electric and water service from the city utilities this requirement does not apply to any generating or electricity producing facilities owned by the resident or customer 3 authority this section was adopted pursuant to the councils authority under  62115 2  19658 and ch 197 wis stats in addition to the extent issues related to the electric and water utility operations are within the citys power under art xi 3 of the wisconsin constitution the city is utilizing its authority under that provision and 6601 wis stats to adopt this section 4 service requirement a condition of annexation any person or landowner petitioning the city for annexation of property to the city shall agree as a condition of annexation that any electric power and water service requirements for the property will upon annexation be obtained from the city utilities the landowner will cooperate in all ways with the city to effect this requirement 5 waiver the council may agree to release a customer from these requirements on a temporary basis where special circumstances are shown but may at any time thereafter advise the customer that the requirements will be enforced 6 severability each subsection of this section is severable and the failure or invalidity of one subsection shall not affect the validity of the remaining subsections 1304  use of utility income the income of the city utilities shall be used to meet operation maintenance depreciation interest and debt service fund requirements  local and school tax equivalents  additions and improvements  and other necessary disbursements or indebtedness income in excess of these requirements may be used to purchase and hold interest bearing bonds issued for the acquisition of the city utilities or bonds issued by the united states or any municipal corporation of this state 1305  assessments 1 special assessment procedure see 812 of this municipal 2 wis stats adopted in addition to those special assessment procedures adopted by the council in 812 of this municipal the council may elect to levy special assessments pertaining to electric facilities as provided in this section whenever the city utilities shall construct or acquire by gift purchase or otherwise a distribution system or a production or generating plant for the furnishing of electric service to the city or its inhabitants or shall make any extensions thereto the city may assess the whole or any part of the cost thereof to the property benefited thereby whether abutting or not in the same manner as is provided for the assessment of benefits under 6660 wis stats 1306  collection of delinquent water and electric charges rep & recr #960377 1 authority the common council of the city of oconomowoc adopts 1b and 1bn wis stats by reference 2 procedure a the operations manager shall inform the city treasurer before october 15 of each year of all lots or parcels for which water andor electric charges are still owed for service supplied in the year preceding october 1 am #10o781 b on october 15 in each year notice shall be given by the water andor electric utility to the owner or occupant of all lots or parcels of real estate to which utility service has been furnished prior to october 1 and payment for which is owing and in arrears at the time of giving such notice the water andor electric utility shall furnish the city treasurer with a list of all such lots or parcels of real estate and the notice shall be given by the city treasurer such notice shall be in writing and shall state the amount of such arrears including any penalty assessed pursuant to the rules of the water andor electric utility that unless the delinquent account is paid by november 1 thereafter a penalty of 10 percent of the amount of such arrears will be added thereto  and that unless such arrears with any such added penalty shall be paid by november 15 thereafter the same will be levied as a tax against the lot or parcel of real estate to which utility service was furnished and for which payment is delinquent such notice may be served by delivery to either such owner or occupant personally or by letter addressed to such owner or occupant at the post office addresses of such lot or parcel of real estate on november 16 the city treasurer shall certify and file with the clerk a list of all lots or parcels of real estate giving the legal descriptions thereof to the owners or occupants of which notice of arrears in payment were given as above specified and which arrears still remain unpaid and stating the amount of such arrears together with the added penalty thereon as herein provided 3 lien for delinquent charges each delinquent amount including penalty shall thereupon become a lien upon the lot or parcel of real estate to which the utility service was furnished and payment for which is delinquent and the city clerk shall insert the same as a tax against such lot or parcel of real estate all proceedings in relation to the collection of general property taxes and to the return and sale of property for delinquent taxes shall apply to said delinquent tax if the same is not paid within the time required by law for payment of taxes upon real estate 4 water or electric utility service to rental dwelling units a this section applies only if all of the following conditions are met 1 water and electric utility service is provided to a rental dwelling unit 2 the owner of the rental dwelling unit notifies the utility in writing of the name and address of the owner 3 the owner of the rental dwelling unit notifies the utility in writing of the name and address of the tenant who is responsible for payment of the utility charges 4 if requested by the utility the owner of the rental dwelling unit provides the utility with a copy of the rental or lease agreement in which the tenant assumes responsibility for the payment of the utility charges b the water or electric utility shall comply with at least one of the following methods of notification 1 the water or electric utility shall send bills for water or electric service to a customer who is a tenant in the tenants own name upon notification to a customer who is a tenant that charges for water or electric service provided by the utility to the customer are past due for more than one billing cycle the utility shall also serve a copy of the notice on the owner of the rental dwelling unit in the manner provided in 801142 wis stats if a customer who is a tenant vacates the rental dwelling unit and the owner of the rental dwelling unit provides the public utility no later than 21 days after the date on which the tenant vacates the rental dwelling unit in the manner set forth below 2 the water or electric utility shall serve notice of the past due charges on the owner of the rental dwelling unit within 14 days of the date on which the tenants charges become past due the public utility shall serve notice on the owner of the rental dwelling unit in the manner provided in 801142 wis stats 1307  utilities subject to pscw jurisdiction 1 filing of schedules am #000480 in accordance with 19619 wis stats the city utilities shall file with the public service commission of wisconsin all schedules showing the rates charges rules and regulations governing the electric water and communications services provided by the city utilities 2 conflicts in case of a conflict between this municipal the schedules on file with the public service commission of wisconsin the schedules shall control 3 information available to customers am #10o781 the operations manager shall have available in the office of the city utilities copies of the utilities rates and rules the rates and rules shall be available for customer inspection   capital cost recovery charges  cr #06o677 1 defined a charge levied on new users within certain designated service areas to reimburse the developer that initially financed the improvements for the cost of capital improvements that benefit all of the properties in the designated service area 2 established capital cost recovery charges shall be collected by the city from properties that benefit from but were not initially required to finance and pay a special assessment for or otherwise contribute to the cost of capital improvements within certain designated service areas capital cost recovery charges are hereby established for properties that meet all of the following criteria a are located within an area benefited by a water system or sanitary sewer improvement for which the city has levied special assessments b were located outside of the city at the time when the special assessments were levied c capital costs for the improvements were allocated to the property in the engineers report 3 amount of capital cost recovery charges the amount of the charge shall be the amount allocated to each property plus any interest as specified in the engineers report 4 collection of capital cost recovery charges capital cost recovery charges calculated and due pursuant to this section shall be collected by the city prior to connection to the sanitary sewer or water system 5 disposition of capital cost recovery charges all charges collected pursuant to this section shall be deposited in an appropriate segregated fund the city shall use all charges collected pursuant to this section to reimburse the developer that initially financed the improvements for which the charges are to be collected within 30 days of receipt editors note of o677 adopted nov 21 200 enacted provisions creating a new 1308 inasmuch as there already exists such a transmission facilities to retail customers 1310  application for electrical service 1 written application application for electrical service shall be made by the owner of the premises or the occupant thereof with written consent of the owner in writing on a form furnished by the city utilities the application shall contain a street address andor legal description of the property to be served the use to be made of service and such other information as the utilities may require 2 site plan layout if the request for electrical service is larger than 200 amp the applicant shall submit in addition to a copy of the building permit a site plan layout of the electrical underground services required and the location of the transformer no permit shall be issued for multiplefamily dwellings stores manufacturing plants or shopping centers unless such material is submitted with the application and approved 3 refusal of service the city utilities may refuse electrical services if the permittee fails to install the electrical service connection in accordance with the approved plans 1311  electrical service 1 meters am #10o781 electric meters shall be furnished by the city utilities and installed under the direction of the operations manager not more than one customer may receive electricity meter unless each pays the minimum rate if the meter registers less than that amount no unauthorized person shall tamper with an electric meter 2 right of entry to inspect meter employees of the city utilities shall have access to the consumers premises at all reasonable hours to inspect the meter and exchange the same if necessary 3 responsibility of consumer the consumer of electricity shall be responsible for all electricity used on the consumers premises until notice to the contrary is given at the office of the city utilities 4 notification of alteration etc the consumer shall notify the city utilities of all alterations additions and repairs on wires on the consumers premises and such work shall be done in accordance with utilities psc rate file the rules and regulations of the utilities and to the satisfaction of the building inspector 5 alterations and repairs all alterations and repairs to wires and fixtures on consumers premises shall be at the expense of the consumer and the city utilities may shut off electricity until all necessary repairs are made 6 liability restricted the city utilities shall not be liable for failure to furnish electricity if such failure is caused by accidents strikes or other causes beyond the control of the utilities 7 electric bills electric bills will be rendered monthly 8 reconnection of service am #10o781 if the utility disconnects any electrical service for a lawful permitted reason such service shall not be reconnected except by order of the operations manager and on payment of necessary fee and such other terms as the city may determine 9 discontinuing service am #10o781 any person desiring to discontinue the use of electricity shall give notice thereof in writing to the operations manager 10 compliance with electric utility standards and specifications cr #06o667 all contractors proposing to install or revise electric service on property within the city of oconomowoc shall comply with the public service commission rules set forth in 1309 of the municipal shall comply with local standards and specifications contained in book form and available for inspection at the utility office the standards and specifications book contains construction or installation standards and specifications for electric infrastructure electric utility staff may periodically add to or revise the standards and specifications any electric service construction or installation which violates the standards and specifications is subject to removal or disconnection 1312  consequences of failing to pay electric charges 1 disconnection if a customer fails to pay a delinquent electric bill the city utilities may disconnect the customers electric service refuse further service and take any other steps provided for in psc 113 wis adm disconnection shall be in compliance with psc  wis adm pertaining to cold weather disconnections 2 delinquent bills placed on property tax rolls the city utilities may collect overdue bills by placing the bills on the property tax as provided in  and  wis stats and 1306 of this municipal interference with electrical utility equipment no customer shall destroy injure or interfere with any apparatus or appliance owned by the city utilities and used to provide electric service a customers violation of this section shall be punishable as provided in 2504 of this municipal defacing utility poles 1 no person shall attach to any pole supporting electric wires ie telegraph telephone or electric light poles any advertisement or notice nor shall any person drive or insert any nails brads screws or any other metal substance into any such poles 2 this section shall not apply to the attaching of legal notices or notices given by any officer of the city county state or school district 3 no person shall attach or secure personal property to any pole supporting electric wires ie telegraph telephone or electric light poles street light poles traffic signal poles or flashing warning light poles to attach or secure includes but is not limited to the use of chains or cables with or without padlocks the police department shall cause to be removed any personal property attached or secured to any of the aforementioned public poles a notice shall be prepared which shall describe the personal property and order its removal stating that if the personal property is not permanently removed or the violation is not corrected within 48 hours the personal property shall be removed by the police department the notice shall be attached to the personal property any personal property removed by the police department pursuant to the provisions of this section shall become the property of the city and may be disposed of in any manner deemed appropriate by the city the police department shall store the personal property for not less than 10 days individual developed properties  connection to the city water system will be required for all properties upon private well failure exception replacement of private wells with replacement wells will be permitted if city water is not available and state andor county regulations allow replacement once city water is available connection will be required within 12 years interest will be charged on deferred assessments b riverline subdivision  city water is currently available to properties on the north portion of this subdivision properties can request approval to connect to existing water mains at any time city water to the currently unserved area of this subdivision will become available when sewer is installed or when a majority of the properties petition for city water connection can be deferred for up to 12 years from the date water becomes available to the subdivision assessment for water mains can be deferred for up to 12 years from the date water becomes available or connection to main whichever occurs first interest will be charged on deferred assessments c paganica court subdivision cr #15o872 this subsection applies to all properties improved and unimproved which currently consists of 5 singlefamily residential lots on paganica court extending from silver lake street to its terminus city water to this subdivision will become available when and if sewer is installed or when a majority of the properties petition for city water when and if city water becomes available connection to the city water system can be deferred for up to 12 years from the date water becomes available to the subdivision assessment for water mains can be deferred for up to 12 years from the date water becomes available or connection to main whichever occurs first with regard to the 5 lots in this subdivision or any newlycreated lots private wells shall be authorized until public water becomes available d vacant or undeveloped land  am #15o872 development or improvement of vacant land will be permitted only when water and sewer are available to the land being improved e temporary connection to city water  am #15o872 if a residential or commercial well fails and a temporary connection can be made to an existing water main this connection will be permitted with the following conditions 1 property owner agrees to pay all costs of temporary connection and acquires all necessary easements  2 property owner agrees to install temporary service per city specifications  3 property owner agrees to connect to permanent main when it becomes available  4 property owner agrees to abandon temporary service when the city installs the permanent main  and 5 property owner agrees to pay the assessment for the permanent main when it is installed f private well abandonment 1319  compulsory connection to water system  am #10o768 the owner of any public commercial mercantile or business building or any building used for human habitation situated in the city and adjacent to a water main is required to connect such buildings to the water supply as provided for in 1107 and 1303 of this municipal requirement shall be interpreted consistent with the provisions of 13174 with regard to town of summit properties attached to the city 1320  application for water service 1 written application application for water service or for any extension or alteration of an existing service shall be made in writing by the owner of the property or an authorized agent therefor on a form furnished by the city utilities the application will contain the legal description andor street address of the property to be served the name of the owner the exact use to be made of the service and the size of the supply pipe and meter desired the city utilities may withhold approval of any application if full information of the purpose of the water supply is not clearly indicated by the applicant 2 approval of application upon approval of an application the building inspector shall issue a permit to the licensed plumber selected by the applicant which authorizes the plumber to do the work a permit shall be issued for each service connection for each building residence or business place and for each branch connection when more than one connection is made by one service pipe 3 licensed plumber am #10o781 no person whose premises is to be supplied with water shall employ any person other than a licensed plumber or fitter named in the permit to make the connection or attachment if a licensed plumber is not used the operations manager may withhold water service to the premises 4 limitation on use of water no person shall use or permit any water to be used for any purpose not designated in the permit 5 deposits and guaranteed contracts prior to providing service the city utilities may under certain circumstances first require a deposit from the customer or a guaranteed contract provisions governing deposits may be found in psc 185 wis adm copy of psc 185 may be obtained from the city utilities office 6 other rules the water utility operating rules and regulations filed with the public service commission of wisconsin also govern applications for service these rules as part of city utilitys rate file include provisions on conditions of service options for service to a multiunit dwelling and service to a lot or parcel a copy of these rules may be obtained from the city utilities office 1321  installation of water service 1 installation requirements the installation of all new extended or altered water services shall conform to the requirements and specifications for water construction as determined by the city utilities the water construction specifications and installation requirements are on file in the city utilities office the specifications of the city utilities shall be no less strict than the specifications set forth in chs ilhr 82 and 84 nr 811 and psc 185 wis adm 2 no plastic pipes no plastic pipe may be used in the installation of individual service laterals between the water main and the stop box the city utilities are required to thaw the service laterals in the event of freezing plastic pipes cannot be thawed with heat and thawing by reversing the flow of hot water would violate the regulations on crossconnections 3 refusal of service am #10o781 the operations manager may refuse water service to a permittee if such permittee fails to install the water service connection in accordance with the approved plans 4 turning on water a consumers water cannot be turned on for a consumer except by a duly authorized employee of the utilities 1322  responsibility for care of pipes 1 property owners responsibility any person being supplied water from the city utilities shall at his or her expense maintain the service pipes from the curb stop to the point of use and all fixtures connected to the service pipes in good repair and protected from frost the alignment and proper maintenance of the stop box remains the responsibility of the proper owner 2 consequences of failure to repair if an owner fails to repair a leaking or broken service pipe from curb stop to point of metering or use within such time as may appear reasonable to the city utilities the utilities will shut off the water after notification has been given to the owner by the utilities the water will not be turned on again until the repairs have been completed 3 utilitys responsibility the service pipe from the main to and curb stop will be maintained and kept in repair and when worn out replaced at the expense of the city utilities 4 shutting off water during repairs the city utilities reserve the right to shut off the water in the mains temporarily to make repairs alterations or additions to the plant or system no rebate will be allowed to consumers for such temporary suspension of water supply 5 limitation on claims no claim shall be made against the city because of 1 the breakage of any main pipe service pipe cock or any equipment or machinery or 2 any interruption of supply because of stoppage for necessary repairs 1323  water meters 1 connection all water service shall be connected with a meter furnished by the city the meters shall be installed by the city utilities or at the utilities option an authorized licensed plumber in accordance with the requirements established by the city utilities the owner of the premises at his or her expense must provide a suitable location and proper connections for a meter in accordance with the requirements established by the city utilities see also the water utility operating rules filed with the public service commission of wisconsin a copy of these rules may be obtained from the city utilities office 2 maintenance meters will be repaired by the city utilities the cost of repairs caused by ordinary wear and tear will be borne by the city utilities the cost of repairs caused by damage to a meter resulting from the carelessness or negligence of the owner of the premises the owners agent or tenant shall be paid for by the consumer or the owner of the premises 3 access to meters am #10o781 the operations manager or a duly authorized person shall be given access to the premises and buildings for the purpose of examining or repairing any meter or connection meters shall be left in the condition and manner as set and shall not be interfered with 1324  water charges 1 rates the current rates for service are set forth in the water utility rate file which is on file with the public service commission of wisconsin 2 calculation of bills water charges are calculated as set forth in psc 185 wis adm also provides the procedure for reading meters estimating charges and adjusting erroneous charges a copy of psc 185 may be obtained from the city utilities office 3 billing all water charges shall be billed and paid for as set forth in the water utility rate file currently water charges are billed monthly and if the water charges are not paid within 20 days of billing interest or penalties shall be added to the bill a copy of the current rate file may be obtained from the city utilities office 4 miscellaneous charges other charges such as installation charges reconnection charges hydrant charges and meter charges are as set forth in the current water utility rate file which is on file with the public service commission of wisconsin a copy of the current rate file may be obtained from the city utilities office 1325  consequences of failing to pay water charges 1 disconnection if a customer fails to pay water charges the city utilities may disconnect the customers water service refuse further service and take the other steps provided for in psc 185 wis adm 2 delinquent bills placed on property tax rolls the city utilities may collect overdue bills by placing the bills on the property tax as provided in  wis stats and 1306 of this municipal protective devices the owner or occupant of every premises receiving water supply shall apply and maintain suitable means of protection of the premises water supply and all appliances thereof against damage arising in any manner from the use of the water supply variation of water pressure or any interruption of water supply for specific rules regarding protective devices including but not limited to relief valves air chambers and pressure safety cutout devices see the water utility operating rules filed with the public service commission of wisconsin a copy of these rules may be obtained from the city utilities office 1327  termination of service 1 vacation of premises when premises are to be vacated the city utilities shall be notified in writing at least 3 working days prior to vacation so that it may remove the meter and shut off the water supply at the curb valve the owner of the premises shall be liable for water used and any damage to the property of the city utilities by reason of failure to notify the city utilities of the vacancy 2 capping required if any building is moved razed or otherwise altered so as to expose or leave abandoned water utility terminals such terminals shall be appropriately capped in accordance with the standards established by the city utilities all such capping shall be done at the expense of the owner of the premises or person responsible therefor 1328  bonding of authorized personnel the council may authorize persons to fulfill certain obligations of the city utilities any person authorized by the council shall at the time of receiving the appointment execute and deliver to the city clerk a bond with one or more sureties approved by the council in the amount set by the city conditioned that he or she will indemnify and save harmless the city of and from all damages caused by any careless or improper work done by him or her 1329  service beyond city limits 1 extensions prohibited except as otherwise provided by the common council no water connection shall be extended to property outside the current city limits as reflected in the current city map which is incorporated herein by reference 2 exceptions this section shall not interfere with or abrogate the rights of any present users of record connected to the municipal water services outside the city limits as reflected in the modified city map which is incorporated herein by reference and on file with the city clerk 3 reserved rep #000473 1330  crossconnection control 1 defined a crossconnection shall be defined as any physical connection or arrangement between 2 otherwise separate systems one of which contains potable water from the city water system and the other water from a private source water of unknown or questionable safety or steam gases or chemicals whereby there may be a flow from one system to the other the direction of flow depending on the pressure differential between the 2 systems 2 crossconnection prohibited no person shall establish or maintain or permit to be established or maintained any crossconnection no interconnection shall be established whereby potable water from a private auxiliary or emergency water supply other than the regular public water supply of the city may enter the supply or distribution system of the city unless such private auxiliary or emergency water supply and the method of connection and use of such supply shall have been approved by the city utilities and by the state dnr in accordance with nr 811092 wis adm 3 inspections the city utilities shall cause inspections to be made of all properties served by the public water system where crossconnections with the public water system is deemed possible the frequency of inspections and reinspections based on potential health hazards involved shall be as established by the city and as approved by the state dnr 4 right of entry upon presentation of credentials the representative of the city utilities shall have the right to request entry at any reasonable time to examine any property served by a connection to the public water system of the city for crossconnections if entry is refused such representative shall obtain a special inspection warrant under  wis stats on request the owner lessee or occupant of any property so served shall furnish to the inspection agency any pertinent information regarding the piping system on such property 5 discontinuance the city utilities is hereby authorized and directed to discontinue water service to any property wherein any connection in violation of this section exists and to take such other precautionary measures deemed necessary to eliminate any danger of contamination of the public water system water service shall be discontinued only after reasonable notice and opportunity for hearing under ch 68 wis stats except as provided in subsection 6 water service to such property shall not be restored until the crossconnection has been eliminated in compliance with the provisions of this section 6 emergency discontinuance if it is determined by the city utilities that a crossconnection or an emergency endangers public health safety or welfare and requires immediate action and a written finding to that effect is filed with the city clerk and delivered to the customers premises service may be immediately discontinued the customer shall have an opportunity for hearing under ch 68 wis stats within 10 days of such emergency discontinuance 7 state code the city adopts by reference the state plumbing chs ilhr 82 and 84 wis adm section does not supersede the state plumbing the citys plumbing but is supplementary to them 1331  private well abandonment  am #04o612 1 purpose the purpose of this section is to prevent unused andor improperly constructed wells from serving as a passage for contaminated surface or near surface waters or other materials to reach the usable groundwater these wells must be properly abandoned and sealed 2 coverage all private wells locate on any premises which is served by the public water system of the city shall be properly abandoned only those wells for which a well operation permit has been granted by the water utility may be exempted from this requirement subject to conditions maintenance and operation 3 well operation permits a permit may be granted to a well owner to operate a well for a period not to exceed 5 years if the following requirements are met a application shall be made on forms provided by the city engineer and shall be renewed every 5 years b the well and pump installation meet the requirements of ch nr 812 wis adm a well constructors report is on file with the state c the well has a history of producing safe water and presently produces bacteriologically safe water as evidenced by 2 samplings 2 weeks apart d the proposed use of the well can be justified as being necessary in addition to water provided by the public water system e no physical condition shall exist between the piping of the public water system and the private well 4 methods wells to be abandoned shall be abandoned according to the procedures outlined in ch nr 812 wis adm pump and piping must be removed and the well checked for obstructions prior to plugging any obstruction or liner must be removed 5 reports and inspection a well abandonment report must be submitted by the well owner to the city engineer and water utility on forms provided by the agency available in the office of the city engineer the report shall be submitted immediately upon completion of the well abandonment which must be observed by a representative of the city 6 penalty any well owner violating any provision of this section shall upon conviction be subject to a forfeiture as provided in 2504 of the municipal hour period during which a violation exists shall constitute a separate offense 1332  wellhead protection the city has restricted groundwater recharge areas as to uses permitted in said areas see  of this municipal these wellhead protection provisions am #13o841 1333  private well maintenance  cr #04o612 all maintenance on a private well must be completed andor inspected by an individual licensed under ch nr 146 wis adm user regulations 1345  creation the common council pursuant to the provisions of  wis stats does hereby declare that the sewerage system of the city consisting of the collection system as hereinafter defined waste collection and disposal operations sewerage system and all other appurtenances and equipment used for such purposes or wastewater treatment facility as hereinafter defined shall be designated the sewerage system utility this public utility is not a public service subject to regulation by the wisconsin public service commission for the purposes defined above 1346  management 1 the operation management and control of the sewerage system utility is vested in the common council acting as the board of public works under the provisions of 1 wis stats and is hereinafter referred to as the approving authority all records of the sewerage system utility shall be kept by the operations manager in the city hall or other officially designated place am #10o781 2 the rules regulations and rates hereinafter set forth shall be considered part of the regulations applicable to every individual or entity connected to the sewerage system and all persons discharging wastes to the sewerage system such rules regulations and rates may be changed from time to time as determined by the common council and the right is reserved to make special rates and contracts in all proper cases 3 the common council shall cause an annual audit of the books of the sewerage system utility to be made and shall make the books and records relating to the sewerage system utility available for inspection during regular business hours 4 a proportionate distribution of operation maintenance and replacement costs shall be maintained among other user classes users shall be notified annually of the sewer service charges associated with the sewerage system 5 the sewerage system utility shall be able to utilize the full authority provided in  wis stats with respect to financing methods sewerage service charges and other matters therein dealt with and shall have all legal authority permitted for municipal utilities to charge reasonable rates for services 1347  application the application of this subchapter its rules regulations and rates shall apply to all individuals firms corporations and institutions residing within the corporate limit of the city and any person firm or corporation by attachment to the sewerage system or otherwise by contract or agreement coming within the city sewer service area subsequent to the effective date hereof and all entities hauling wastes or trucking wastes and discharging to the sewerage system 1348  definitions the meaning of terms used in this subchapter shall be as follows act the federal water pollution control act 33 usc 1251 et seq as amended by the federal water pollution control act amendments of 1972 pl 92500 and pl 93243 or as modified by ch 147 wis stats or appropriate sections of the wisconsin administrative pursuant to ch 147 approving authority the common council or its authorized deputy agent or representative bod the quantity of oxygen expressed in milligrams per liter mgl utilized in the biochemical oxidation of organic matter under standard laboratory conditions for 5 days at a temperature of 20c the laboratory determinations shall be made in accordance with procedures set forth in standard methods building sewer lateral or service pipe a sewer which carries only sewage or industrial wastes from the building plumbing to the public sanitary sewer capital costs the cost of acquiring purchasing leasing planning designing constructing extending and improving all or any part of the sewerage system and of paying principal interest or premiums on any indebtedness incurred for these purposes capital costs may be recovered utility ratemaking model which includes components for depreciation and return on invested capital commercial user am #000473 any property occupied by a nonresidential establishment not within the definition of an industrial user and which is connected to the wastewater facilities collection system the system of sewers and appurtenances for the collection transportation and pumping of domestic wastewater and industrial use connection each physical connection to the collection system or private sewer system which connects to the municipal collection system connection charge a charge levied on users annually for each lateral connected to the public sanitary sewer the revenues generated from the connection charge shall be used to cover expenditures relating to customer costs and costs related to flow not attributable to users infiltrationinflow debt retirement all annual principal and interest requirements and obligations of the approving authority for the wastewater treatment facility discharge the introduction of pollutants into the wastewater treatment facility from any nondomestic source regulated under 307b c or d of the federal act discharge monitoring station a sampling and metering station required to be installed discharge monitoring agreement signed by an industrial user with the city in order to obtain information on that users discharge to the system and to establish sewer user and debt charges domestic wastewater waterborne wastes normally being discharged from the sanitary conveniences of dwellings apartment houses hotels office buildings factories and institutions free of industrial wastes and in which the average concentration of suspended solids is established at or below 270 mgl and the bod is established at or below 250 mgl flow proportional composite sample a sample consisting of portions of waste taken in proportion to the volume of flow of such wastes indirect discharge see discharge industrial cost recovery recovery by the approving authority from the industrial users of the sewerage system of the amount allowable for the treatment of wastes from such users pursuant to 204b of the federal act industrial user am #000473 any nonresidential user identified in division a b d e or i of the standard industrial classifications manual industrial user also shall include any user that discharges wastewater containing toxic or poisonous substances as defined in 307 or 502 of the clean air act or any substances causing interference within the wastewater facilities industrial user shall include any nonresidential user who 1 is subject to national categorical pretreatment standards 2 has a nondomestic flow of 25000 gallons or more per average work day 3 contributes more than 5 percent of the average dry weather capacity of the wastewater facility or 4 is determined by the approving authority or operations manager to have the potential to adversely affect the wastewater facility industrial waste any waterborne solids liquids or gaseous wastes other than domestic wastewater resulting from discharge from flow from or escape from any commercial industrial manufacturing or food processing operation or process from the development of any natural resource  or any mixture of these with water or domestic wastewater intercepting sewer a sewer constructed to receive the dry weather flow of untreated or inadequately treated sewage from one or more existing sanitary sewer system terminals other than from a dwelling or building that presently discharges or formerly discharged flow directly into any waters of the state and convey the flow to a wastewater treatment facility or is to serve in lieu of an existing or proposed wastewater treatment facility interference the inhibition or disruption of any sewer system wastewater treatment process sludge disposal system or their operation which substantially contributes to a violation of applicable discharge permits natural outlet any outlet into a watercourse pond ditch lake or other body of surface or groundwater normal sewage sanitary sewage in which bod and total suspended solids concentrations do not exceed normal concentration of a a 5day 20c bod of not more than 250 parts per million b a total suspended solids concentration of not more than 270 parts per million operation and maintenance cost o&m the actual sums spent by the city in the operation and maintenance of its sewerage system consisting of but not limited to each and all of the following purposes a wages and salaries of employees related to expenses of operation maintenance clerical laboratory and supervisory personnel together with fringe benefits and premiums paid on such wages and salaries for the state workmens compensation coverage b electrical power and other utility services c chemicals fuel and other operating supplies d repairs to and maintenance of associated equipment e premiums for hazard insurance f premiums for insurance providing coverage against liability for the injury to persons andor property g rents and leasing costs h operation licensing and maintenance costs for trucks and heavy equipment i consultant and legal fees j training and educational expenses operations manager the operations manager of the wastewater treatment and conveyance facilities who shall be in charge of and supervise the operations and functions of the wastewater treatment and conveyance facilities and who shall report to the city administrator persons any and all persons natural or artificial including any individual firm company municipal or private corporation association governmental agency or other entity and agents servants or employees ph the logarithm base 10 of the reciprocal of the hydrogen concentration expressed in moles per liter it shall be determined by one of the procedures outlined in standard methods pretreatment the reduction of the amount of pollutants the elimination of pollutants or the alteration of the nature of pollutant properties in wastewater before discharge to the city wastewater facilities private sewer a privately owned sewer serving 2 or more buildings and not directly controlled by a public authority public sewer a sewer or lateral in a public rightofway or easement abutting properties and that is controlled or owned by the public authority replacement fund expenditures for obtaining and installing equipment accessories and appurtenances which are necessary during the useful life of the treatment works to maintain the capacity and performance for which such works were designed and constructed residential equivalency charge a charge levied on nonmetered users for operation and maintenance replacement capital and depreciation the charge shall be based on the average gallons of water used by a residential customer for operation and maintenance replacement capital and depreciation residential equivalent connection rec the wastewater flow and loadings to the system equivalent to that contributed by an average residential family equivalent an average residential family equivalent shall be calculated yearly by the city based upon the residential water used divided by the total number of residential customers residential user am #000473 all premises used only for human residency and that are connected to the wastewater facilities sanitary sewer a sewer that conveys domestic wastewater or industrial waste or a combination of both and into which storm surface and groundwater or unpolluted industrial wastewater are not intentionally contributed septage scum liquid sludge or other waste from a septic tank soil absorption field holding tank vault toilet or privy this does not include the waste from a grease trap sewerage system all facilities for collecting transporting pumping treating and disposing of domestic wastewater industrial wastes and septage also may be referred to as sewer system sewer availability charge a charge levied on all new users of the sewage system or current users who expand their use of the sewer service system this charge shall be based upon the historic costs existing customers have contributed to the sewer facility infrastructure and the loss of interest thereon funds collected from sewer availability charges shall be used to finance improvements to the sewer service system slug any discharge of water or wastewater which in concentration of any given constituent or in quantity of flow exceeds for any period longer than 15 minutes more than 5 times the average 24hour concentration or flows during normal operation and which adversely affects the collection system andor performance of the wastewater treatment facility standard methods the examination and analytical procedures set forth in the latest edition of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater as prepared approved and published jointly by the american public health association and the water pollution control federation storm sewer a sewer which carries storm and surface drainage but excludes domestic wastewater and industrial wastes surcharge user a user of the sewerage system who discharges wastes which have higher concentrations than domestic wastewater and is assessed an additional charge surcharge for the constituents higher in concentration than domestic wastewater total suspended solids tss solids that either float on the surface of or are in suspension in water sewage or other liquids and which are removable by a laboratory filtration device quantitative determination of total suspended solids shall be made in accordance with procedures set forth in standard methods also referred to as suspended solids toxics any of the pollutants defined by federal regulations pursuant to 307a1 of the act unpolluted water water of quality equal to or better than the effluent criteria in effect or water that would not cause violation of
