in force at the time of calculation 1 the property owner shall submit on forms provided by the city a good faith estimation of the intended water and sewer usage for a nonresidential development 2 based upon the information supplied by the property owner under subsection 1 the city shall calculate the number of recs for that development by dividing the intended water use by the annualized amount as defined in definitions 270416a b or c all rec calculations shall be rounded up to the nearest 05 rec an interim fee shall be calculated by multiplying the calculated recs by the fee schedule as in table 1 above 3 since the impact fee determined under subsections 1 and 2 above is based upon estimated intended usage the city shall have the right to recalculate the charge based upon actual usage for any 12month period at anytime between the first and third anniversary dates of establishment of the nonresidential account the city may review the account history to determine a highest actual recorded usage in any 12month period 4 based upon the information obtained under subsection 3 above the city shall recalculate the number of recs and may recalculate the impact fee pursuant to subsection 2 above if the recalculated charge exceeds that of the original charge the difference between the recalculated charge and the amount paid for the original charge shall become due and payable at the time the adjustment is made by the current owner of the property if reviewed pursuant to subsection 3 above the calculations and billing shall be accomplished within 6 months of the end of the third year 3 irrigation meterscommercial and industrial users a all commercial or industrial users choosing to irrigate their property must install irrigation meters to meter this water use city coverage 2710  calculation of impact fee  am #10o782 the city shall calculate the impact fee as follows 1 highways and other transportation facilities impact fee a residential development  1 verify the number and type of residential dwelling units 2 determine the applicable per unit impact fee 3 multiply the applicable per unit impact fee by the appropriate number of residential dwelling units b nonresidential development  see 27095c above c mixed use development  separately calculate the impact fee as set forth above for each type of development d redevelopment  1 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for the redeveloped use 2 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for its current predevelopment use 3 subtract the amount of the impact fee that would be imposed for the current use from the amount that would be imposed for the redeveloped use 2 law enforcement facilities impact fee a residential development  1 verify the number and type of residential dwelling units 2 determine the applicable per unit impact fee 3 multiply the applicable per unit impact fee by the appropriate number of residential dwelling units b nonresidential development  see 27096c above c mixed use development  separately calculate the impact fee as set forth above for each type of development d redevelopment  1 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for the redeveloped use 2 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for its current predevelopment use 3 subtract the amount of the impact fee that would be imposed for the current use from the amount that would be imposed for the redeveloped use 3 fire protection and emergency medical facilities impact fee a residential development  1 verify the number and type of residential dwelling units 2 determine the applicable per unit impact fee 3 multiply the applicable per unit impact fee by the appropriate number of residential dwelling units b nonresidential development  see 27097c above c mixed use development  separately calculate the impact fee as set forth above for each type of development d redevelopment  1 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for the redeveloped use 2 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for its current predevelopment use 3 subtract the amount of the impact fee that would be imposed for the current use from the amount that would be imposed for the redeveloped use 4 parks playgrounds and land for athletic facilities impact fee a residential development  1 verify the number and type of residential dwelling units 2 determine the applicable per unit impact fee 3 multiply the applicable per unit impact fee by the appropriate number of residential dwelling units b nonresidential development  see 27098d above c mixed use development  separately calculate the impact fee as set forth above for each type of development d redevelopment  1 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for the redeveloped use 2 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for its current predevelopment use 3 subtract the amount of the impact fee that would be imposed for the current use from the amount that would be imposed for the redeveloped use e hotel redevelopment cr #16o899 1 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for the redeveloped use 2 calculate the total amount of the impact fee that would be imposed on the property for its current predevelopment use 3 subtract the amount of the impact fee that would be imposed for the current use from the amount that would be imposed for the redeveloped use 4 multiply the amount by 25 2711  administration of impact fee  1 collection of impact fee a for all developments impact fees shall be payable within 14 days after the issuance of a building permit under of the municipal b the effective date of a building permit is the date on which all impact fees imposed under this chapter are paid in full and unless all impact fees are paid in full within 14 days after issuance as required by 6g wis stats said building permit shall expire 15 days after issuance c for any new development for which impact fees were paid prior to final plat or certified survey map approval impact fees shall not be imposed as a condition of issuance of a building permit 2 transfer of funds to accounting department upon receipt of impact fees the city accounting department shall be responsible for placement of such fees into separate accounts as hereinafter specified 3 establishment and maintenance of accounts the city accounting department shall establish a separate interestbearing account for fees collected for each subarea interest or income earned by each account shall be credited to that account and shall be used solely for the purposes specified for such account the city accounting department shall maintain records for each such account as hereinafter specified 4 maintenance of records the city accounting department shall maintain and keep adequate financial records for each such account which shall show the source and disbursement of all revenues which shall account for all moneys received and which shall ensure that the disbursement of moneys from each account shall be used solely and exclusively for the provision of projects specified in the capital improvements program for the particular development subarea 5 annual review and modification the city may periodically review the development potential of each subarea and the capital improvements plans and make such modifications as are deemed necessary as a result of a development occurring in the prior year  b public facilities actually constructed  c changing facility needs  d inflation  e revised cost estimates for public facilities  f changes in the availability of other funding sources applicable to public facility projects  and g such other factors as may be relevant with the exception of annual increases to account for inflation any impact fee modifications resulting from changes in development potential or capital improvements programs will require a public hearing as described in 2717 2712  bonding of excess facility projects  impact fees paid pursuant to this be restricted to use solely and exclusively for direct financing of public facilities or as a pledge against bonds revenue certificates and other obligations of indebtedness for the cost of public facilities as specified herein 2713  refunds 1 the current owner of the property with respect to which the impact fees were imposed may apply for a refund of such fee along with any interest that has accumulated as described in 8 wis stats if a for impact fees paid prior to  the city has failed to provide a public facility serving such property within 10 years of the date of payment of the impact fee for parks playgrounds and land for athletic facilities and highways and other transportation facilities  second street lift station  north interceptor sewer  and north water tower  and within 20 years of the date of payment of the impact fee for law enforcement facilities and fire protection and emergency medical facilities  or b for impact fees paid on or after  the city has failed to use the impact fees within 7 years of the date of the payment of the impact fee for the capital costs for which they were imposed for parks playgrounds and land for athletic facilities highways and other transportation facilities second street lift station north interceptor sewer north water tower law enforcement facilities and fire protection and emergency medical facilities c as permitted by 9b wis stats the 7year time limit for using impact fees that is specified under paragraph b may be extended for 3 years if the city adopts a resolution stating that due to extenuating circumstances or hardship in meeting the 7year limit it needs an additional 3 years to use the impact fees that were collected the resolution shall specify the extenuating circumstances or hardship that led to the need to adopt a resolution under this paragraph d the building permit for which the impact fee has been paid has lapsed for noncommencement of construction  or e the project for which a building permit has been issued has been altered in a manner which has resulted in a decrease in the amount of the impact fee due  or f as otherwise authorized in this 2 a written petition for refund must be filed with the city administrator or hisher designee within one year of the event giving rise to the right to claim a refund failure to do so as provided herein shall be considered a waiver of the right to claim a refund under this chapter 3 within 10 business days of the filing date of a petition for refund the city administrator shall forward a copy of the petition for refund to the appropriate department head within 30 business days of receipt the appropriate department head shall submit a written report and recommendation to the city administrator the city administrator shall review this report and make a written recommendation to the city council within 45 days of the date of the city administrators written recommendation the city council shall adopt a resolution denying approving or approving in part the refund petition 4 if the petitioner wishes to appeal the decision of the city council the petitioner may commence an action in the waukesha county circuit court seeking review of the councils decision within 30 days after the date on which the council adopted the resolution with respect to the petition for refund 2714  appeals  1 notice of appeal any developer upon whom an impact fee has been imposed may contest the amount collection or use of the impact fee by filing a notice of appeal to the city council the notice of appeal shall be filed with the city clerk within 30 days of the date of the determination therein appealed the notice of appeal shall state in detail the relief sought by the developer and any legal or factual basis for the relief requested  and shall include all supporting documentation upon which the developer relies in making the appeal 2 appeal bond if the notice of appeal is accompanied by a bond or other sufficient surety satisfactory to the city attorney in an amount equal to the impact fee due as calculated by the city administrator or the administrators designee and all other requirements have been satisfied the building permit may be issued the filing of an appeal shall not stay the collection of the impact fee due unless a bond or other sufficient surety has been filed 3 review by the city council a within 10 business days of the date of filing of the notice of appeal the city administrator shall forward a copy of the notice of appeal to the appropriate department head within 30 business days of receipt the appropriate department head shall submit a written report and recommendation to the city administrator the city administrator shall review this report and make a written recommendation to the city council b within 45 days of the date of the city administrators written recommendation the city council shall adopt a resolution denying approving or approving in part the appeal 4 review by circuit court if the developer wishes to appeal the decision of the city council the developer may commence an action by certiorari in the waukesha county circuit court seeking review of the councils decision within 30 days after the date on which the council adopted the resolution with respect to the developers appeal 2715  effect of impact fee on zoning and subdivision regulations  this not affect in any manner the permissible use of property density of development design and improvement standards and requirements or any other aspect of the development of land or provision of public improvements subject to the zoning and subdivision regulations or other regulations of the city which shall be operative and remain in full force and effect without limitation with respect to all such development 2716  impact fee as additional and supplemental requirement  except as required by 6d wis stats the impact fees imposed under this chapter are additional and supplemental to and not in substitution of any other requirements imposed by the city on the development of land or the issuance of building permits 2717  amendments  1 public hearing before enacting an ordinance that amends the city council shall hold a public hearing on the proposed ordinance or amendment 2 notice pursuant to 3 wis stats notice of the public hearing referred to in the preceding section shall be published as a class 1 notice under ch 985 wis stats and shall specify where a copy of the proposed ordinance or amendment and the public needs assessment may be obtained 3 public facilities needs assessment before enacting an ordinance that imposes impact fees or amending an ordinance that imposes impact fees by revising the amount of the fee or altering the public facilities for which impact fees may be imposed a needs assessment shall be prepared and made available for public inspection and copying as required by 4 wis stats 2718  credits 1 a property owner may elect to construct a public facility listed in the capital improvements plan for which an impact fee has been imposed if the property owner elects to construct such a public facility the property owner must enter into an agreement with the city prior to issuance of any building permit in any such agreement the city shall reasonably provide for credits for other past or future monetary or nonmonetary contributions by the developer to the construction of the same public facility as follows a present value of amounts contributed within the last 3 years for any land dedications physical improvements or financial contributions made for the construction of the public facility  b present land dedications and physical improvements made for the construction of the public facility  c future land dedications physical improvements made for the construction of the public facility for a period not to exceed 3 years 2 in no event shall credit provided under subsection 1 be greater than the otherwise applicable fee 3 no credits shall be given for the construction of local onsite facilities required by zoning subdivision or other city requirements or which are not included in the capital improvements program 2719  penalty in addition to any other remedy which the city may have for any violation of any portion of this chapter any person who shall violate any provision of this chapter shall be subject to a penalty as provided in of the city municipal violation and each day a violation continues or occurs shall constitute a separate offense this section shall not preclude the city from maintaining any appropriate action to prevent or abate a violation of this chapter chapter 28  joint stormwater utility 2801 general provisions 2802 application 2803 pabst farms joint stormwater district commission 2804 severability of provision 2805 violations and penalties 2801  general provisions  cr #030567 1 findings and necessity the city of oconomowoc and the town of summit find that the management of stormwater and other surface water discharges within the city and the town is a matter that affects the health safety and welfare of the area its citizens and businesses and others in the surrounding area failure to effectively manage stormwater affects the sanitary sewer system operations of the area by among other things increasing the likelihood of infiltration and inflow in the sanitary sewer system in addition surface water runoff may create erosion of lands threaten businesses and residences with water damage and create environmental damage to the lakes streams and other water bodies within and adjacent to the pabst farms joint stormwater district surface water runoff if not controlled will impact not only on the aforementioned lakes and streams and other water bodies but will also degrade the groundwater within the district and in areas adjacent thereto the cost of operating and maintaining the pabst farms joint stormwater management system and financing the necessary repairs replacements improvements and extensions thereof should to the extent practicable be allocated in relationship to the impact on and services received from the system in order to protect the health safety and welfare of the public the city and the town hereby exercise their respective authorities to establish a stormwater utility and establish the rates for stormwater management services 2 authority this ordinance is adopted under the authority granted by chs 60 62 and 66 wis stats including but not limited to the following sections  62115 6216  6218    and  3 establishment a there is hereby established the pabst farms joint stormwater utility the operation of the stormwater utility shall be under the supervision of the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission b the city and the town have contracted to enact this ordinance as a uniform method of regulation of surface water management throughout the district the municipalities will enact the ordinance as a regulatory ordinance applicable to the area of each municipality that falls within the legally defined district 4 commission authority the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission stormwater utility may acquire construct lease own operate maintain extend expand replace clean dredge repair conduct manage and finance such facilities as are deemed by the commission to be proper and reasonably necessary for a system and storm and surface water management these facilities may include without limitation by enumeration surface and underground drainage facilities sewers water courses retaining walls and ponds and such other facilities as will support a stormwater management system 5 intergovernmental agreement adopted by reference a the intergovernmental agreement entered into by the town and the city attached hereto as exhibit a hereinafter the intergovernmental agreement and all future modifications and amendments thereto are hereby adopted by reference as though set forth in full in this ordinance b those property owners to whom this ordinance applies are required to comply with the terms of the intergovernmental agreement a violation of or failure to comply with any provision of said agreement shall be considered a violation of this 02  application  cr #030567 1 application the application of its rules regulations and rates shall apply to all individuals firms corporations and institutions owning property within the pabst farms joint stormwater district 2 stormwater management plan and facilities required no owner of property within the pabst farms joint stormwater district shall proceed with any development or redevelopment or with the final division of property for residential purposes by means of platting or certified survey map unless said property owner has submitted to and has received approval of a sitespecific stormwater management plan by the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission property owners developing redeveloping or dividing property shall also comply with the district regulations as defined in the intergovernmental agreement 3 permit requirements no property owner shall undertake a land development redevelopment or final residential property division activity subject to the requirements of this ordinance without first receiving a permit from the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission 4 application and fee permit applications shall be made on a form provided by the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission the application must be accompanied by the sitespecific stormwater management plan required under the provisions of this ordinance and district regulations and a nonrefundable permit administration fee in an amount as from time to time established by the commission 5 permit compliance no construction as defined in the intergovernmental agreement shall be undertaken prior to the issuance of a permit by the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission and all construction must be performed according to the approved sitespecific stormwater management plan 2803  pabst farms joint stormwater district commission  cr #030567 1 creation of the commission the parties have established a commission known as the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission by the intergovernmental agreement 2 composition the composition of the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission the authority of the commission and the method of operation by the commission shall be as set forth in the intergovernmental agreement 2804  severability of provision  cr #030567 if any section subsection sentence clause or phrase of this ordinance is for any reason held to be invalid or unconstitutional by reason of any decision of any court of competent jurisdiction such decision shall not affect the validity of any other section subsection sentence clause or phrase or portion thereof 2805  violations and penalties  cr #030567 1 any person who fails to comply with any of the provisions of this joint ordinance or with an order of the city town or the pabst farm stormwater district commission issued pursuant to this ordinance shall be liable to the city town or the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission for any expense loss or damage occasioned by such violation including reasonable attorney fees and other expenses of litigation  and upon conviction for any violation of this ordinance shall be subject to a forfeiture of not less than $10000 nor more than $250000 per violation plus damages each day a condition is allowed to exist which is contrary to all or any part of this ordinance including the intergovernmental agreement adopted by reference herein shall constitute a separate violation change of ownership or occupancy of premises delinquent under the provisions of this ordinance shall not be cause for reducing or eliminating charges due and penalties for violations 2 in addition to the court proceedings and penalties described in the foregoing subsection of this ordinance whenever a person violates any provision of said ordinance or fails to comply with any order of the city town or the pabst farms joint stormwater district commission the city town or commission may order that an action be commenced on behalf of the city town or commission in the county court for waukesha county for the purpose of obtaining an injunction restraining the person violating this ordinance or failing to comply with the order from further violating this ordinance or any rule or regulation of the commission charter ordinance an ordinance to provide for the manner of selecting an assessor for the city of oconomowoc the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows from and after the date of termination of the term of office of the present city assessor the office of city assessor in the city of oconomowoc shall be filled by appointment of the mayor subject to the confirmation of the council all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this ordinance shall take effect and shall be in full force and effect sixty days following its passage and publication s frank j dumbeck mayor s fred c behrend clerk passed  published  charter ordinance an ordinance amending the charter of the city of oconomwoc wisconsin the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows that section of the original charter of the city of oconomowoc entitled officers their election appointment qualifications compensation  vacancies is hereby amended to read as follows from and after the date of termination of the term of office of the present city treasurer the office of treasurer in the city of oconomowoc shall be filled by appointment by mayor subject to confirmation by the common council the offices of city treasurer and city assessor may be held by the same person all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this ordinance shall take effect sixty days following its passage and publication s frank j dumbeck mayor s edgar e otto clerk published  charter ordinance an ordinance amending the charter of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows that section of the original charter of the city of oconomowoc entitled officers their election appointment qualifications compensation  vacancies is hereby amended to read as follows from and after the date of termination of the term of office of the present city clerk the office of clerk in the city of oconomowoc shall be filled by appointment by the mayor subject to confirmation by the common council all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this ordinance shall take effect sixty days following its passage and publication s frank j dumbeck mayor s edgar e otto clerk passed  published  charter ordinance an ordinance amending the charter of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows that section of the original charter of the city of oconomowoc entitled officers their election appointment qualifications compensation  vacancies is hereby amended to read as follows from and after the date of termination of the term of office of the present city treasurer the office of city treasurer in the city of oconomowoc shall be filled by appointment by the mayor subject to confirmation by the common council all ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict herewith are hereby repealed this ordinance shall take effect sixty days following its passage and publication s frank j dumbeck mayor s edgar e otto clerk passed  published  a charter ordinance relating to the selection and tenure of city administrative officials the common council of the city of oconomowoc do ordain as follows the city of oconomowoc hereby elects not to be governed by those portions of 3b and 5b of the wisconsin statutes relating to the method of selection and tenure of the city assessor city clerk city treasurer director of public works city engineer superintendent of parks and recreation director which are in conflict with this ordinance hereafter instead of being appointed annually by the mayor and approved by the council the city assessor city clerk city treasurer director of public works city engineer and director of recreation shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the majority vote of the members elect of the common council for a term as provided in the said city assessor city clerk city treasurer director of public works city engineer and recreation director shall hold office for an indefinite term subject to removals provided by law tenure shall not apply to any person appointed to any of the above positions during the initial one 1 year of their employment which shall be considered a probationary period the common council may by resolution designate additional full time supervisory personnel as being eligible for tenure status under this ordinance this ordinance shall apply to those individuals holding a term of office at the present time which term has not yet expired this is a charter ordinance which shall take effect sixty 60 days after its passage and publication unless within such sixty 60 days a referendum petition shall be filed as provided by of the wisconsin statutes in which event this ordinance shall not take effect until submitted to a referendum and approved by a majority of the voters voting thereon s h o hughes s bergman city clerk adopted  published  code comparative table  ordinances landscaping charts city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  chapter 17 zoning ordinance subchapter 170 introduction amended o857  adopted  these regulations are adopted under the authority granted by 7  and 8730 of the wisconsin statutes this be known as referred to and cited as the zoning ordinance city of oconomowoc wisconsin and is hereinafter referred to as the  this zoning applicable to all territory located within the corporate limits of the city of oconomowoc intent this adopted for the following purposes 1 to promote land uses and development patterns that are consistent with the citys comprehensive plan and adopted neighborhood corridor or special area plans 2 to promote and protect the public health safety and general welfare of the city 3 to secure safety from fire flooding pollution contamination and other dangers 4 to maintain and promote safe pedestrian and vehicular circulation 5 to minimize congestion in the public rightsofway regulation of offstreet parking maneuvering loading and signage 6 to ensure the provision of adequate open space for light air fire safety and recreation 7 to protect environmentally sensitive areas 8 to remove obstacles and provide incentives for energy conservation and renewable energy 9 to promote the conservation protection restoration and enhancement of historic resources 10 to facilitate the adequate efficient and costeffective provision of infrastructure and other public services and facilities 11 to preserve the natural scenic beauty of the city 12 to encourage reinvestment in established urban neighborhoods while protecting their unique characteristics 13 to stabilize and protect property values 14 to protect groundwater resources 15 to prevent the overcrowding of land and avoid undue concentration of population 16 to facilitate the adequate provisions of transportation water sewerage and burial sites city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  to comprehensive plan the citys comprehensive plan establishes the objectives goals and policies that serve as a basis for this zoning provisions of this all amendments to this be consistent with the citys comprehensive plan as adopted and revised or updated application this to all land and land development within the jurisdictional limits of the city of oconomowoc wisconsin 1 no structure shall be constructed erected modified converted enlarged reconstructed altered placed or maintained and no land shall be used modified or maintained for any purpose or in any manner which is not in conformity with the provisions of this 2 in their interpretation and application the provisions of this be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety morals and general welfare 3 where the conditions imposed by any provision of this either more restrictive or less restrictive than comparable conditions imposed by any other law ordinance statute resolution or regulation of any kind the regulations which are more restrictive or which impose high standards or requirements shall prevail unless an exception to this provision is specifically noted 4 this not supersede any easement covenant or other private agreement however this if it is more restrictive or imposes higher standards or requirements than an easement covenant or other private agreement 5 any use building structure or lot that lawfully exists at the time of the adoption of this or any subsequent amendments may be continued subject to the provisions of this 6 a building structure or use that was unlawful when this adopted does not become lawful solely by reason of the adoption of this said building structure or use is made lawful by this the extent that the unlawful building structure or use conflicts with this the building structure or use remains unlawful under this 7 in their interpretation and application the provisions of this be held to be minimum requirements and shall be liberally construed in favor of the city and shall not be construed to be a limitation or repeal of any other power now possessed by the city of annexed land pursuant to wisconsin state statutes when any territory is brought into the jurisdiction of the city by annexation or otherwise such territory shall be deemed to be in the ur urban reserve district unless the city council designates another zoning district at the time of annexation after review and recommendation by the plan commission giving due consideration to the surrounding uses as well as the comprehensive plan and provides notice that complies with the requirements of this following requirements also apply to annexed land city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  1 all lands annexed to the city after  shall be subject to the waukesha county shoreland zoning effect at the time of annexation unless the city enacts administers and enforces a zoning ordinance for the annexed area that complies with the shoreland zoning standards and that is at least restrictive as the county shoreland zoning scope of regulations all buildings erected hereafter all uses of land or buildings established hereafter all structural alterations or relocation of existing buildings occurring hereafter and all enlargements of or additions to existing uses occurring hereafter shall be subject to all regulations of this are applicable to the zoning districts in which such buildings uses or land shall be located 1 all new building sites shall meet the requirements of this prior to the effective date of this a building permit was issued and is still valid  provided construction is begun within one 1 year of such effective date and prosecuted to completion said building may be a completed in accordance with the approved plans on the basis of which the building permit has been issued and b may upon completion be occupied as approved in the building permit by the use for which it was originally designated 2 where the city has issued a zoning approval pursuant to the provisions of this the approval shall become null and void unless the work thereon is underway within one 1 year of the date of issuance of such approval 1 in the event that any section of this be declared or judged by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unconstitutional such adjudication shall in no manner affect the other sections of this which shall be in full force and effect as if the said section or said sections were not originally a part thereof 2 if any court of competent jurisdiction shall adjudge invalid the application of any provision of this a particular property building or structure such judgment shall not affect the application of said provision to any other property building or structure not specifically included in said judgment it is not intended that this or interfere with any constitutionally protected vested right it is also not intended that this repeal annul impair or interfere with any existing easements covenants deed restrictions agreements rules regulations or permits previously adopted pursuant to earlier versions of this transition rules this section addresses the applicability of new substantive standards enacted by this activities actions and other matters that are pending or occurring as of the effective date of this of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  1 any application that has been filed with the city planning department or building inspector and has been determined to be fully complete by the city planner prior to the effective date of this shall be regulated by the terms and conditions of the ordinances and codes that were in place at the time of the filing however all administrative procedures and penalties shall follow those set forth by this 2 except as noted otherwise any application for a zoning map amendment that was filed and has been determined to be fully complete by the city prior to the effective date of this shall continue process to completion pursuant to the terms and conditions of the ordinances and codes that were in place at time of filing 3 planned development districts in force at the time of adoption of this continue to be controlled under the standards of the existing planned development district however processes for approving or amending adopted final development plans or site plans shall follow the procedures of this 4 zoning districts use lists and definitions applicable to previously approved documents including rezoning planned development districts easements deed restrictions and similar agreements shall remain in force 5 any application before the zoning board of appeals or any application that has been filed with the planning department and is determined to be fully completed by  prior to the effective date of this shall continue the process pursuant to the terms and conditions of the were in place at the time of filing of conflicting ordinances and effective date all ordinances or parts of ordinances in conflict with this zoning inconsistent with the provisions of this are hereby repealed to the extent necessary to give this force and effect this become effective on  city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  subchapter 171 establishment of zoning districts the area located within the corporate limits of the city being the jurisdiction of this is hereby divided into zoning districts of such number and community character as are necessary to achieve compatibility of land uses within each district to implement the officially adopted city comprehensive plan and to achieve the purposes of this zoning districts established in order to carry out the purposes and provisions of this the following zoning districts are hereby established zoning district map symbol rural residential rr suburban residential sr traditional residential tr multiunit low residential rml multiunit high residential rmh isthmus residential multi irm isthmus residential single irs general commercial gc mixeduse commercial mc business park bp industrial i urban reserve ur institutional  public ip of zoning district map the location and boundaries of the zoning districts are hereby established as shown on the map entitled official zoning map on file in the office of the zoning administrator the official zoning map together with all information shown thereon and all amendments thereto shall be as much as part of this if fully set forth and described herein 1 location of district boundaries the following rules shall apply with respect to the boundaries of the zoning districts as shown on the zoning district maps a a boundary shown as following a street alley or railroad shall be construed as following the centerline of such feature b a boundary line shown as following a lot line section line survey or other property line or municipal boundary shall be construed as following such line or boundary city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  c when any highway or public ground acquired or held for highway purposes is discontinued the land where the highway or public ground is located shall belong to the owner or owners of the adjoining lands and shall be construed to be the same zoning district as the lots if the highway or public ground is located between the lands of different owners it shall be attached to the lots to which it originally belonged if that can be ascertained if the lots to which the land originally belonged cannot be ascertained the land shall be equally divided between the owners of the lands on each side of the highway or public ground d where any uncertainty exists as to the exact location of zoning district boundary lines the zoning board of appeals upon written application shall determine the location of such boundary lines districts 1 general purposes of all residential zoning districts the residential zoning districts are intended to a provide appropriately located areas for residential development that are consistent with the comprehensive plan and with standards for public health safety and general welfare  b ensure adequate light air and privacy for all dwelling units with respect to density  c minimize traffic congestion and overloading of public services and utilities  d protect residential neighborhoods from incompatible uses that create excessive noise illumination unsightliness odor and smoke  and e create a mixture of residential uses and preserve edges and transitions between districts 2 rural residential rr the rr zone is intended for development of housing at a target density of 10 dwelling units per gross acre detached singlefamily housing will be the predominant housing type in this zone 3 suburban residential sr the sr zone is intended for development of housing at a target density of 30 dwelling units per gross acre detached singlefamily housing will be the predominant housing type in this zone 4 traditional residential tr the tr zone is intended for development of housing at a target density of 60 dwelling units per gross acre detached singlefamily housing will be the predominant housing type in this zone 5 multiunit low residential rml the rml zone is intended for development of housing at a target density of 80 dwelling units per gross acre small lot singlefamily housing duplexes attached dwellings and multidwelling residences will be permitted housing types subject to the density limitations of the zone 6 multiunit high residential rmh the rmh zone is intended for development at a target density of 120 dwelling units per gross acre multiunit residential buildings will be the predominant housing type in this zone rmh zoning is generally applied near heavily traveled roadways and adjacent to commercial districts city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  7 isthmus residential multi irm the irm zone is intended for development at a target density of 100 dwelling units per gross acre the irm zone is applied in the isthmus between fowler lake and lac la belle 8 isthmus residential single irs the irs zone is intended for development at a target density of 50 dwelling units per gross acre irs zone is applied in the isthmus between fowler and lac la belle and north of the north lake road bridge residential and other districts 1 general purposes of all nonresidential and other districts the nonresidential and other zoning districts are intended to a provide appropriately located areas consistent with the comprehensive plan for retail service office and industrial uses  b strengthen the citys economic base and provide employment opportunities close to home for residents of the city and surrounding communities  c provide parks open space and other public facilities that serve the needs of the community  and d minimize any negative impact of nonresidential development on adjacent residential districts 2 general commercial gc the gc zone is established to provide for shopping service and office facilities adjacent to heavily traveled roadways this district is intended to meet the convenience shopping and service needs of city residents and attract people from surrounding communities 3 mixeduse commercial mc the mc zone is established to promote a concentration of mixed uses including retail service office and residential uses the location mix and configuration of land uses are designed to encourage convenient alternatives to the automobile safe and attractive streetscape and a more livable community 4 business park bp the bp zone is intended for a broad range of office light industrial uses and other complimentary uses that promote high quality new development the purpose of this district is to permit a variety of uses that will provide professional employment within the city while at the same time providing personal and professional services to the employees working within this zoning district 5 industrial i the i zone is intended for industrial uses that are generally not compatible with residential development because of their operational characteristics this district is also intended for uses that may require outdoor areas to conduct business activities or for product storage or display the purpose of this district is to permit the normal operations of any industry that can meet and maintain compliance with established state and federal performance standards 6 urban reserve ur amended o887  adopted  the district is intended to provide a transition between surrounding town agriculturalrural residential areas on large parcels of land at a low rate of population density this district also serves as a holding zone for recently attached city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  or annexed properties to the city until the property is rezoned to a different zoning district the city will not issue building permits for new singlefamily residential dwelling units on parcels over 10 acres in size within the ur urban reserve zoning district unless the property owner prepares an overall site development plan for the property and strategically places the dwelling on a future lot per the site development plan the site development plan shall include the conceptual layout of future lots streets access points utility lines and significant environmental features sewer and water supply shall be extended to serve the proposed dwelling and the location thereof shall be based on the future lot layout all city fees regarding public infrastructure needed to serve the proposed dwelling including any outstanding special assessments or capital cost recovery charges are required to be paid by the owner at time of permit all easements requested by the city shall be granted at no cost by the property owner prior to release of building permit no more than one dwelling will be allowed on each ur zoned parcel until the property is rezoned and developed in accordance with the citys comprehensive land use plan 7 institutionalpublic ip the ip zone is intended to serve larger institutional facilities such as churches campus school sites and associated playgrounds hospitals sewer and water treatment facilities and cemeteries the district is for uses such as governmental services education facilities public parks open space and similar activities of allowed uses the table below lists the uses allowed within all zoning districts all uses are defined within this zoning of a use listed within this table and compliance with the applicable specific standards for use types authorize that use only development or use of a property for any other use not specifically allowed in this table and approved under the appropriate process is prohibited 1 explanation of table abbreviations a permitted byright uses p in a cell indicates that the use is permitted by right in the respective zoning district subject to all other applicable regulations of this zoning the specific standards for use types b conditional uses c in a cell indicates that in the respective zoning district the use is allowed only if reviewed and approved with conditions in accordance with the procedures and applicable regulations of this c prohibited uses a blank cell indicates that the use is prohibited in the respective zoning district 2 table organization the table of allowed uses classifies land uses and activities into general use categories and specific use types based on common functional product or physical characteristics such as the type and amount of activity the type of customers or residents how goods or services are sold or delivered and site conditions this classification provides a systematic basis for assigning present and future land uses into appropriate zoning districts this classification does not list every use or activity that may appropriately exist within the categories and city of oconomowoc zoning ordinance  updated  specific uses may be listed in one category when they may reasonably have been listed in one or more other categories the use categories are intended merely as an indexing tool and are not regulatory 3 classification of new and unlisted uses the city recognizes that new types of land use will develop and forms of land use not anticipated in the zoning seek to locate in the city when application is made for a use type that is not specifically listed in the table of allowed uses the zoning administrator shall make a determination as to the appropriate classification of any new or unlisted form of land use in the following manner a the zoning administrator shall provide an interpretation as to the zoning district into which such use should be placed in making such interpretation the zoning administrator shall consider the nature of the use and whether it involves dwelling activity sales processing type of product storage and amount and nature thereof enclosed or open storage anticipated employment transportation requirements the amount of noise odor fumes dust toxic material and vibration likely to be generated and the general requirements for public utilities such as water sanitary sewer and electrical b standards for new and unlisted uses may be interpreted as those of a similar use c appeals of the zoning administrators decision shall be made to the zoning board of appeals following the procedures of this of allowed uses p  permitted c  conditional use residential nonresidential and other use category use type r r s r t r r m l r m h i r m i r s g c m c bp i i p u r residential uses household living dwelling singlefamily detached p p p p p p p p dwelling duplex space p p p p p p p p p p p p p park p p p p p p p p p p p p p educational facilities college or university p p p elementary or secondary school p p p agricultural uses agriculture cultivation p commercial uses animal related services kennel c c c c c c veterinary clinic p p p p p p animal grooming p p p p p p financial services bank or similar use p p p p payday loan business p p bar or
